loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is a teacher. She is a divorced woman living in Armavir and her only son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country.

Lusine has been working at a local school as a teacher for eight years. Together with the work in school, she also provides individual classes to a small group of children in her house. In one of the small rooms in her house, Lusine organizes classes with her students. She has now applied for this loan to purchase a table, chairs, and some literature for classes. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with reasonable conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to traditional credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a table, chairs, and some literature for classes

loans.name: José Benjamín

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad, es una persona que tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar 9° grado de educación básica, la situación económica no le permitió salir a estudiar a la Ciudad, hoy en día está acompañado su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuidado de la niña quien es menor de edad y necesita cuido.
 
José se dedica a la agricultura desde que dejo de estudiar, hoy en día se dedica a la siembra de plátano más o menos desde hace unos 8 años,  es el único cultivo que le ayudado a salir adelante, el trabajo lo aprendía porque su padre es a lo que se dedica. El trabajo le queda a unos 8 kilómetros de distancia y tiene que viajar todos los días más en el verano para regar la planta, casi siempre anda trabajando unas 10 horas diarias, porque también le dan vigilancia.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una motocicleta para viajar  a su trabajo, ya que le queda lejos y siempre está comiendo comida fría y así es ta considerando viajar atraer la comida para él y sus familiares que también trabajan en el mismo lugar coman a la hora indicada y con ello estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.  
 
El sueño más grande de Benjamín es tener un medio de transporte propio que le permita moverse más rápido a cualquier lugar y así como a comercializar el producto cuando ya este de venta, pero esto lo va a lograr si es apoyado con el crédito.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old.  He had the opportunity to study through ninth grade, but his financial situation did not allow him to go to the city to study.  He is married and his wife cares for their home and their young daughter.

José has worked as a farmer since he left school.  He has been planting bananas for about eight years.  This is the only crop that has helped him move forward.  He learned this work from his father, since he did it too.  His work is about eight kilometers and he has to travel there every day, and more often in the summer to water the plants.  He almost always walks and works ten hours a day.

He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to purchase a motorcycle to travel to his fields, since he needs to travel a long distance and he is always eating cold food.  He thinks that he can travel to get food for him and his relatives that work in the same location so they can eat at the right time.  This will improve his family's quality of life.

Benjamín's biggest dream is to have his own form of transportation that will allow him to travel more quickly from place to place and sell his products when they are for sale.  He will achieve this dream if his loan is funded.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to travel to his fields.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, es una mujer que apoya en los gastos de su hogar y lo hace generando ingresos con la venta de frutas, verduras bebidas, pan, golosinas y otros productos en su tienda; su núcleo familiar está compuesto por su esposo y tres hijos, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad los cueles tienen trabajos independientes al de ella; el negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, simultáneamente salen a vender de manera ambulante, no tiene horario definido, es apoyada por su esposo.
Comprará papas, tomates, pipianes, manzanas, papayas, rábanos, plántanos, etc., con la inversión incluirá nuevos productos frescos que demandan sus clientes, el tener un mejor inventario atraerá nuevos clientes,  mejorara sus ventas y contara con mejores ingresos para cambiar las circunstancias familaires.
Su visión es establecer mejor su negocio, cancelar su deuda e iniciar con la venta de ropa como un nuevo rubro.
texts.en:
Maribel is a woman who supports her household by selling fruits, vegetables, drinks, bread, snacks, and other products in her store.  Her family is made up of her husband and her three children.  Her children are already independent adults with jobs of their own.  Her business is located in her home and she also goes out to sell as a street vendor.  She has no set schedule and is supported by her husband.

She will use this loan to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, chilies, apples, papayas, radishes, bananas, and other items so that she can meet her customers' demands for fresh products.  Having a better inventory will attract new customers.  She will improve her sales and earn more income to change her family's circumstances.

She envisions establishing her business more, repaying her debt, and starting a new business selling clothing.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, chilies, apples, papayas, radishes, bananas, and other items to be able to meet her customers' demands for fresh items.

loans.name: Indira Vanessa

texts.es: Indira, tiene 30años, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijas y reside con ellas en un sector suburbano del municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace dos años se dedica a la venta de comida donde ofrece ricos platos con pollo frito con tajadas,con papas o con tortillas. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada pero vio que el negocio de comida es mas rentable. El préstamo que solicita es de 10,000 lempiras, el cual invertirá en la compra de materia prima como ser carne de pollo, condimentos, papas, harina de maíz para tortillas, banano verde para tajadas y otros insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus comidas para vender. Considera que podrá aumentar sus ventas y su clientela con esta inversión. Su meta a futuro es comprar material de construcción para construir una caseta o local para vender comidas.
texts.en:
Indira, 30, is a single mother with two daughters.  She lives with them in a suburban area of the town of San Pedro Sula.

She has earned a living for two years selling food: delicious dishes of fried chicken with plantains, potatoes, or tortillas.  She has always worked in commerce.  Previously she sold used clothing, but she saw that the food business is more profitable. 

Indira's requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy chicken, spices, potatoes, corn flour for tortillas, plantains for fried plantains, and other ingredients she needs to make her dishes to sell.

She thinks she'll be able to increase her sales and expand her clientele with this investment.  Her goal for the future is to buy construction supplies to build a little stall or a retail space to sell food.

loans.use: to buy chicken, spices, potatoes, corn flour, plantains, and other ingredients to make her dishes

loans.name: Flor De Manzana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE MANZANA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Linzen es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de frutas, venta de frutas, tienda de barrio.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Linzen es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta producción de fruta; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que empieza su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente al cultivo lo comercializará a las vendedoras minoristas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The “Flor de Manzana” Communal Bank will begin the first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Regional Office.  It is composed of eight members, and led by a board of directors, of which Señora Linzen is secretary.  

The members of the communal bank are engaged in various businesses, such as growing fruit, selling fruit, and a neighborhood store. 

The loan they are seeking will benefit the small businesswomen, of whom Señora Linzen is a member.  She says that she is joining Pro Mujer for the first time, at the invitation of an advisor from the institution who came to visit her at her home. 

She has a fruit-growing business. She says that she learned it from her parents, as she had helped with the family business ever since she was a little girl, and now she has started her own business.

The loan that she is seeking is for increasing capital, by purchasing wholesale seeds that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  Later, she will sell her crop to the retail vendors.  This form of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family, as she is single and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale seed.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia Maria se dedica al negocio de ganadería y también la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ganado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, María, has a  livestock business and she also continues with her business selling chichi. The member fattens and raises her cattle and then sells them at various markets.

Maria works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  By means of these businesses she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her livestock selling business.

Maria is requesting funding to purchase cattle. She is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Estela Regina

texts.es:
Estela, mantiene sus diferentes actividades (cultivo de maíz, venta de chocolates y meriendas) con vida gracias a la ayuda del financiamiento que anteriormente se le proporcionó, cuenta con clientes satisfechos, un mejor inventario y nuevos ingresos.
En esta oportunidad requiere un nuevo crédito para comprase papas, aceite, gas propano, platos desechables, palillos, etc. para elaborar parte de las meriendas que vende, espera continuar mejorando.
texts.en:
Estrela maintains her different businesses alive (maize cultivation and the sale of chocolates and afternoon snacks) thanks to help from the funding she received earlier. She has satisfied customers, a better inventory and more income.

At this time, she needs a new loan in order to purchase potatoes, oil, propane gas, disposable plates, toothpicks, etc. to make some of the snacks that she sells.

She hopes to continue improving.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, oil, propane gas, disposable plates, toothpicks, etc. to make some of the snacks that she sells.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RIOS DE AGUA VIVA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valentina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, servicio de cosmetología, taller de joyería, venta de muebles, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), venta de mantas, tejido de prendas de vestir a groché.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valentina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de prendas de vestir a groche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, desde su niñez, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse para emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra lana por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas del departamento de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rios de Agua Viva" (Rivers of Living Water) will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Regional Center. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Valentina is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are: selling fruit, cosmetology services, jewelry workshop, selling furniture, selling chuño (dehydrated potatoes), selling blankets, and crocheting articles of clothing.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these microentrepreneurs, of whom Señora Valentina is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She now has a business of crocheting articles of clothing. She lets it be known that she learned this business from her family when she was a child. With the passing of time she decided to become independent to set up an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her merchandise by buying wool wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors of the department of La Paz. Later, she will sell her products in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she lives in free union and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es: Aura Lila es una mujer  emprendedora de éxito tiene 35 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo quien es su motivo de superación,  su negocio es la venta de perfumes Avon y ropa desde hace nueve años de manera ambulante, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes para damas y caballeros marca Avon y ropa para niños y adultos, etc. Dicha clienta lleva 10 ciclos con la institución y ha sabido aprovechar los préstamos anteriores con la compra de mostradores para los productos.
texts.en:
Aura Lila is a successful, enterprising woman who is 35 years old, married, and is the mother of one son who is her motivation to improve.  Her business is selling Avon perfumes and clothing, which she has done for nine years as a street vendor.

She will use the loan to buy Avon brand perfume for women and men, and clothing for children and adults, etc.  This client has had 10 cycles with the institution and has been able to take advantage of the previous loans with the purchase of counters for the products.

loans.use: to buy Avon brand perfume for women and men, and clothing for children and adults, etc.

loans.name: Yeymi Del Socorro

texts.es: Yeymi es una señora emprendedora, de 35 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos quienes le han apoyado en su negocio, el giro del negocio es vender ropa nueva y usada de manera ambulante desde hace 6 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropas por docenas usada y nueva como camisolas, vestidos, pijamas, chores, camisetas, etc y la clienta lleva dos años trabajando con la institución aprovechando los prestamos anteriores.
texts.en:
Yeymi is an enterprising woman who is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children who help with her business.  The line of business is selling new and used clothing as a street vendor, which she has done for six years.  

She will use the loan to buy packs of new and used clothing by the dozens, like camisoles, dresses, pajamas, shorts, t-shirts, etc.  The client has spent two years working with the institution and taking advantage of the previous loans.

loans.use: to buy packages of new and used clothing by the dozens, like camisoles, dresses, pajamas,  shorts, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Ana, ve que con la ayuda de créditos su negocio está mejorando, por lo que nuevamente solicita capital para comprar ropa, calzado y cosméticos, mantendrá el negocio bien surtido para complacer los gustos de sus clientes y mantener la fuente de ingresos.
La ayuda del crédito anterior ha permitido que Ana tenga mayor demanda de sus clientes, puede competir en el mercado, costear los gastos familiares y está cultivando maíz con las ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana sees that her business is improving with the help of the loans, and for this reason she is again requesting capital to buy clothing, footwear, and cosmetics. She will keep her business well stocked to satisfy the tastes of her customers and maintain her source of income.

The help of the previous loan has allowed Ana to have more demand from her customers. She can compete in the market and pay for the family expenses, and she is raising corn with the earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and cosmetics to keep her business well stocked.

loans.name: Zisung - Nyong-Guma Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is a 47-year-old woman from Nyong-Guma in the Northern region of Ghana. Memunatu is married and has six children. Memunatu is the individual pictured with both hands in the shea butter basin among members squatting.

Memunatu is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last year. The name of the group is ‘Zisung - Nyong-Guma’. Memunatu earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business.  As such, they can always produce premium quality for the local markets and non-local markets.

Memunatu and ‘Zisung - Nyong-Guma’ have asked for a loan of GHS 15,500. Memunatu’s share of the loan will help her to buy GHS 500 of shea nuts for processing. Memunatu aspires to earn more income, as well as to repay this loan and support her family's health and children's educational needs.

Memunatu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha, la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar jora para preparar la chicha.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Felicitas continues working in her business of selling chicha [a corn-based beverage]. She sells from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has already worked in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is applying for the loan to buy jora [a special type of corn] to prepare the chicha.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a special type of corn to prepare chicha

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to purchase educational materials and stationary because her customers always need other
accessories.

loans.name: Mwahui

texts.en:
Mwahui is married with five school-going children. They live in their own house which has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He operates an agricultural selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of disease outbreak and pests affecting his crops.

With the loan he is requesting, for KES 50,000, he wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation for his farm because the season is dry. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation for his farm.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor es un joven soltero y muy trabajador, vive en Pueblo Nuevo junto a su familia. Trabaja brindado servicio de vigilancia y cree que le está yendo bien por su buen desempeño y gracias a la educación de calidad recibida por sus padres. No tiene hijos pero tiene un sobrino que es como si lo fuera, se ha convertido en su mayor motivación para sobresalir porque quiere darle todo lo mejor para que pueda crecer y convertirse en una persona de bien y en un gran profesional.
Victor piensa utilizar este crédito para poder realizar algunas compras como alimentos para su sobrino, así como vestimenta. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque estarán contribuyendo a que Victor pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su sobrino, así seguirá esforzándose para brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia y sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Victor is a single, very hard-working young man. He lives in Pueblo Nuevo with his family. He works offering security services and believes that it is going well for him because of his good performance and thanks to the quality education he received through his parents. He has no children, but he has a nephew who is like a son to him and who has become his great motivation to excel, because he wants to give him all the best so that he can grow and become a good person and a great professional.

Victor is thinking of using this loan to be able to make some purchases such as food for his nephew, as well as clothing. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, because they will be contributing so that Victor can improve the quality of life of his nephew. Thus he will continue striving to offer all the best to his family and help them to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his nephew

loans.name: Olvin Medardo

texts.es: Olvin, tiene 28 años, esta soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente trabajó en una empresa privada y hace 8 años decidió asistir su propia fuente de ingresos. El cultiva plátano para vender, saca plátano grande, mediano y pequeño. Esta producción la vende en la misma zona. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a la Institución para seguir con el mantenimiento. El préstamo es por 30,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de abonos, pago por limpieza, fertilizantes y resiembra de mas plantas de  plátano con el propósito de sacar mejor producción. Tiene su plan de crecer como agricultor con su finca de plátano, granos básicos y otros cultivos.
texts.en:
Olvin is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  Previously, he worked in a private business, and eight years ago he decided to tend to his own source of income.  He grows bananas to sell; he gets big, medium, and small bananas.  He sells this production in the same area.

He is asking for a second loan from the institution in order to continue with maintenance.  The loan is for 30,000 Lempiras, which he will use to buy manure and fertilizer, and to pay for the cleaning and replanting of more banana plants.  His goal is to get a better production.  His plan is to grow as a farmer with his farm of bananas, basic grains, and other crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, and to pay for the cleaning and replanting of more banana plants.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba., perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Nancy  se dedica al negocio de crianza de pollos y tambien tiene un kiosco escolar, la socia los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Communal bank member Nancy works in her business of raising chickens, and she also has a school kiosk. She fattens and raises the chickens and then sells them in various markets. She has already been in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the chickens. She is applying for the loan to buy chickens and feed for them.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, limes, firewood, stoves, and coal.

loans.name: Wendy Lorena

texts.es:
Wendy, comprarte su vida con su esposo de 39 años de edad, dos hijos de 15 y 7 años de edad, todos viven juntos; desde hace 8 años hizo la apertura de una tienda y venta de variedad de granos básicos en el mercado municipal, lo atiende todos los días, su familia le colabora en el negocio, por el momento no representa dificultades.
Utilizará el capital para comprar maíz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, bebidas, boquitas, etc., permitiéndole abastecer su inventario con los productos necesarios para responder a las demandas de sus clientes, podrá contar con clientes satisfechos, mejores ventas e ingresos.
Para Wendy es de suma importancia mantener su negocio competitivo para tener una fuente de ingresos, que necesita para cumplir con sus compromisos y dar a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en: Wendy shares her life with her 39 year old husband, her two children of 15 and 7 years old. They all live together. Eight years ago she opened a store where she sells a variety of basic grains at the Municipal market. She works there every day, and her family helps her in the business which has no problems at the moment. She will use the loan to buy corn, beans, sugar, salt, drinks, snacks, etc. so she stocks up her inventory with the needed products to satisfy her customers' demands. She will be able to have satisfied customers, better sales and income. For Wendy it is extremely important to have a competitive business in order to have a source of income to meet her obligations and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, salt, drinks, snacks, etc. so she stocks up her inventory.

loans.name: Dúo Sol De Justicia Group

texts.es: Dúo Sol de Justicia, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Lisbeth de 55 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de medicina natural ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: The Duo Sol de Justicia (Sun of Justice Duo) group was formed by Señora Lisbeth, who is 55 years old. She has been selling natural medicines for a number of years. At this time, she is applying for the loan to purchase natural medicine, since she has a lot of demand from her customers. She hopes that you can help her with the loan she has applied for.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been selling fruits for the past 10 years with the support of her husband. She is very enthusiastic about her business, and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of five children, and is responsible for their food, health and education and trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. To improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more sacks of bananas to increase sales and boost her earnings for bearing her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of bananas to increase sales and boost her earnings for bearing her household expenses.

loans.name: Niceforo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio se dedica al negocio de maestro de construccion,el socio realiza trabajos de casas, pintados entre otros, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener una  empresa de construccion.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas como pinturas y brochas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa." The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

This bank member works as a master builder. He does work on houses, such as painting, among other tasks. He already has a number of years of experience in this business, and it is going very well for him. His dream is to have a construction business. He is applying for the loan to purchase tools such as paints and brushes.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy tools such as paints and brushes.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la temporada de mejores ventas, ya que se aproximan las graduaciones estudiantiles y posteriormente celebraciones de fin de año, invertirá en rábanos, tomates, pepinos, lechugas, manzanas, guineos, etc., ofertara frutas y verduras frescas a sus clientes.
Para María las condiciones de vida familiar son más dignas, la rentabilidad del negocio es mayor, atiende nuevos clientes y mantiene un buen record crediticio, lo cual es posible por la buena administración del financiamiento anterior.
texts.en:
Maria is applying for a new loan for the season of better sales, since the school graduations and later the end-of-year celebrations are approaching. She will invest in radishes, tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuce, apples, bananas, etc. She will offer fresh fruits and vegetables to her customers. 

For Maria, the family living conditions are more dignified, the profitability of the business is greater, she serves new customers, and she maintains a good credit record, which is possible because of her good administration of the previous financing.

loans.use: to invest in radishes, tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuce, apples, bananas, etc., so that she can offer fresh fruits and vegetables to her customers.

loans.name: Irshad Khan

texts.en:
Irshad has a computer and computer products/accessories buying and selling business in Karachi. He is hardworking and fair. He has gained good experience in this business and feels its the right time to invest more in the business to make it more profitable, given the increasing demand for computers. Most of his customers buy them for personal use and the majority of them are students. 

Irshad is 54 years old and the father of 2 children. He wants to start saving money for his children's marriages and has therefore requested a loan to arrange for the financing to boost sales. He is hopeful for his business and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their ready assistance.

loans.use: to buy computers in bulk to increase sales

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia is 41 years of age. Her great skill in hand embroidery and 9 years of experience in this field have given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand embroidered cloth has grown, and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her 7 children. She also knows the art of stitching clothes to generate extra income. She has requested a loan of 30000 PKR, with which she wants to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames, and beads. She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames, and beads.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Angela es una señora de 67 años de edad, soltera, y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 10 años en su domicilio de la capital, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pacas usadas como ropa de niños y adultos: camisas, pantalones capris, suéter, ropa de cama, etc. Ella tiene dos ciclos de laborar con la institución de manera que ha invertido en su negocio obteniendo altos márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Angela is a 67-year-old single woman who has worked selling second-hand clothes for the last 10 years. She has done this activity at her own house which is located at the capital. 

She is requesting this loan to buy second-hand clothing for children and adults, like: shirts, capri pants, sweaters, bed linen, etc. She has had two loans with this institution, and with the investments she has made in her business she has obtained high profit margins.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for children and adults, like: shirts, capri pants, sweaters, bed linen, etc.

loans.name: Bashra

texts.en: Bashra is 52 years old and works from home as a tailor. She is proud to be contributing to her household income through her business. When Bashra was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. She felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Now she has retained many customers and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR. It will allow her to purchase more stitching material such as spools of thread, packs of buttons, and laces to stitch up more dresses and earn a sufficient amount of income.

loans.use: to purchase more stitching material such as spools of thread, packs of buttons, and laces to stitch up more dresses.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is 40 years old, married and has two children. They are 10 and 15 years old and go to school. Elshan’s wife is a housewife. The family members live in Baku region. 

Elshan has a photo studio where he prints different types of photos. Today Elshan needs help to develop his business and buy a new photo printing machine. For this reason he needs a loan in amount of 1300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He says great thanks to the Kiva organization and lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a new photo printing machine

loans.name: Raihna

texts.en: Raihna is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. Her husband (the man shown in the picture) deals in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for supplying construction materials. In this way, he earns sufficient income to meet the family expenses. In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Raihna contacted Kashf Foundation and has applied for her sixth loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees for the growth of her husband's business. Her husband will utilize this loan amount to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. It will increase his sales and earnings alongside.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate for her husband's construction business.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, trabaja en el cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos, es un hombre hogareño, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 10 y 6 años de edad, los cueles son dependientes; trabaja de manera independiente desde hace 25 años, sus hijos le apoyan en realizar dichas actividades, el horario que tiene actualmente es de 7:30 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., aprendió a desempeñar estas actividades junto a sus padres, las dificultades o buenos resultados en el cultivo dependen de los cambios climáticos.
Está solicitando capital para tener recursos económicos con los que podrá comprar abono, semilla, insecticidas y herbicidas, estos materiales son de ayuda para proteger sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad, espera sacer el mejor provecho de la inversión del crédito, ampliar el área de cultivo y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
Sueña con mantenerse trabajando en el campo para subsistir con su familia, cumplir con sus compromisos y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José works growing basic grains and raising pigs. He likes to be at home and lives with his wife and four children, ages 14, 12, 10 and 6, who are dependent on him. He has worked independently for 25 years. His children support him in doing his duties. 

His current work schedule is from 7:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. He learned to perform this work with his parents. In farming, difficulties or good results depend on the changes in climate.

He is requesting capital in order to have the financial resources with which to buy compost, seeds, insecticide and herbicide. These materials are helpful to protect his crops and improve productivity. 

He hopes to make the most of his investment of the loan, expand the farming area, and giving his family better living conditions. He dreams of continuing to work in the field in order to survive with his family, meet his commitments and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, insecticide, and herbicide. These materials are helpful for protecting his crops and improving productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy medicines to be sold at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo es un microempresario laborioso de 51 años de edad, casado y padre de seis hijos, ninguno depende económicamente de él, es propietario de un taller de vulcanización desde hace trece años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de llantas de camiones, llantas de vehículos, pega, parches y neumáticos, con los créditos anteriores logro ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Domingo is a hard-working, 51-year-old micro-entrepreneur. He is married and is the father of six children, none of whom depends on him financially. He has been the owner of a tire repair workshop for three years.

He is requesting the loan to buy truck rims, vehicle rims, glue, patches and tires. With prior loans he was able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy rims, tires, patches and glue, etc.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 47-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. Her husband has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales for the past five years. Naseem fully supports and assists her husband with his work. They currently have four cows and five buffaloes. Naseem is in her seventh loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees. She wants to use this loan to purchase more animals to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to resell in the market.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 41 year old married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She distills waragi (a local brew) and at the same time does farming. She faces challenges of price fluctuation and little capital. Besides that, she hopes to have enough capital and have an educated family. Juliet needs a loan to rent a banana plantation to make waragi.

loans.use: to rent a banana plantation to make waragi, a local brew

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, tiene 30 años de edad, soltera, y su negocio es la comercialización de prendas de acero, plata y ropa, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de anillos, pulseras, cadenas de material de acero y plata; también para la compra de pacas de ropa tales como chores, camisetas, blusas, pantalones, camisolas, vestidos, etc. Sus productos los comercializa desde hace 3 años de manera ambulante. La clienta lleva un ciclo con la institución y ha demostrado ser una persona laboriosa y emprendedora en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is a responsible and hard-working woman. She is 30 years old, single, and she has a business selling steel and silver jewelry, and clothing items.

She is requesting the loan to buy rings, bracelets, steel and silver chains, as well as bundles of used clothing such as shorts, shirts, blouses, pants, camisoles, dresses, etc.

She has sold her products on foot for over three years. She has been with the institution for one loan cycle and has shown herself to be a hard-working person who is entrepreneurial in her business.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, and steel and silver chains, as well as bundles of used clothing such as shorts, shirts, blouses, pants, camisoles, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a hard working, married woman and is in the business of selling bed sheets and bed covers in her community. She always has a great collection of bed sheets to offer. She is greatly appreciated in her community and she has a good list of customers. Her husband also assists her by making sales door-to-door. 

Rukhsana is a mother of 7 children and she is always worried about their future. To make a greater variety of bed sheets available for sale, Rukhsana is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000. This will enable her to purchase more designs of bed sheets, spreads, and bed covers to offer more variety to her customers. She wants to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more designs of bed sheets, spreads, and bed covers and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.name: Julia  Nelida

texts.es:
La socia Nelida se sigue dedicando al negocio de veterinaria, la socia cura a perros, gatos entre otros animalitos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de veterinaria. La socia solicita el crédito para compara medicinas para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Nelida, works in the veterinary business.  She treats dogs and cats, among other small animals.  The borrower has already worked for several years in this business, and it is going very well.  The borrower’s dream is to expand her veterinary business.  She is requesting a loan to buy medicine for the animals.

The borrower is happy about the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy medicine for animals.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María, mejoro el inventario de su venta de frutas, verduras y granos básicos, pues con el capital que se le facilito anteriormente surtió su inventario, con lo que ha notado que su clientela es mayor, tiene mejores ganancias las cuales le han servido para cancelar su deuda y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Con la visión de mantener la fidelidad de sus clientes requiere un nuevo préstamo para comprar frutas, verduras y granos básicos, el resto será para comprar variedad de flores naturales y artificiales, así tendrá ingresos extras en la celebración de los difuntos.
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan, María was able to increase her stock of fruit, vegetables and basic grains, as well as her clientele. She has better earnings now which have served to cancel her debt and to cover basic needs of her family. 

In order to keep the loyalty of her clients, she needs a new loan to buy fruit, vegetables and basic grains. She will use the rest to buy a variety of natural and artificial flowers, so that she can have some extra income for Halloween.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and basic grains. She will use the rest to buy a variety of natural and artificial flowers, which will give her some extra earnings.

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en:
Maqbool is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of 5 children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, and clothing. She and her husband grow different vegetables and sell them in the local market. She also sells animals to generate extra income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides, Maqbool has applied for a loan of 40000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides to grow more crops.

loans.name: Doris Yesenia

texts.es: Doña Doris Yesenia empezo su negocio vendiendo juguetes y ropa de segunda en el mercado invirtiendo Q800, luego su negocio fue creciendo hasta llegar a tener una librería la que ha tenido hasta ahora ya hace 3 años, su mayor anhelo es llegar a tener mejoras ganacias para agrandar mas la librería, y agradece a DIOS y a su familia por el apoyo que le han brindado hasta ahora, y también agradece a FAPE porque simpre le ha apoyado cuando mas los ha necesitado en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la libreria,esperando que le puedan dar el apoyo que nececita para salir adelante
texts.en:
Doris Yesenia started her business of toys and second-hand clothes with an investment of Q800. The business expanded and added a library 3 years ago. Her dream is to have more income to expand the library. She's grateful to God and her family for the support provided until now, and to FAPE for their support when it has been most needed. 

She is requesting a loan to buy products for the library and expects that she will receive support to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy products for sale for her library.

loans.name: Berta Del Socorro

texts.es:
Berta de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, es la última de todas sus tres hermanas, no estudio, debido a que sus padres no se proponían mejor era el trabajo en las fincas de café.

Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería por días no hay trabajo permanente, de sus tres hijos solo dos estudian y su familia la conforman cinco miembros tomándose en cuenta ella.

Berta el trabajo que realiza es vender antojitos por las calles todas las tardes, tiene seis años de dedicase a este trabajo por lo que tiene muchos clientes algo que no puede dejar de llevárselos todos los días, a este trabajo se dedicó por la necesidad que tenían de preparar la casa donde viven, así fue como emprendió mientras su esposo hace el esfuerzo por otro lado. 
 
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar ocho quintales de maíz y unas cinco galones de aceite, ya que así se evita de estar viajando hasta el mercado casi todos los días ya que viaja ocho kilómetros de ida y vuelta además le sale muy caro y construirá unas gradas para mejorar la entrada a su casa de esa manera mejorara su calidad de vida y de su familia.
  
El sueño de Berta es seguir aumentando el negocio, tener los materiales que necesita ya que algunos días no ha salido porque se ha quedado sin producto y en cuanto a su familia quieren que ellos si estudien, es una meta.
texts.en:
31-year-old Berta went to school until the end of the sixth grade. She is the youngest of three sisters. She did not study at university since her parents did not think it was better than working on the coffee plantations.

Her husband makes a living as a bricklayer. He doesn’t have permanent work. Of their three sons, only two are studying. Her family has five members, including Berta.

Berta’s job is selling snacks on the streets every afternoon. She has been doing this work for six years, which is why she has many clients. She started doing this work because they needed to get the house where they live ready; she undertook this work while her husband put effort in at his work.

The loan she is requesting is for buying eight quintals of maize and five gallons of oil, since then she will not have to go to the market almost every day. It is eight kilometres to the market and back and it becomes very expensive. She will also build some stairs to improve the entrance of her house, thereby improving her and her family’s quality of life.

Berta’s dream is to continue improving the business, to have the materials that she needs since some days she has not gone out because she has no products left, and to see her children go to university.

loans.use: to buy eight quintals of maize and five gallons of oil, so she can avoid going to the market almost every day

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her shop with retail goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television to furnish her house

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Doña Isabel, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside con su esposo en una aldea del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Doña Isabel tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería, vende cameras, toallas, camisas, blusas y jeans. Esta mercadería la vende en su casa y por encargos, y ya cuenta con buena clientela. Ha obtenido varios prestamos para mantener el negocio, actualmente solicita el sexto ciclo a la institución y es por 20,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar mercadería como es jeans, cameras, toallas, blusas, camisas y camisetas para surtir y vender, aprovechando la temporada de fin de año. Su plan es crecer con el negocio para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Isabel is 55 years old. She is married, has three children, and lives with her husband in a village in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Isabel has been selling merchandise for more than ten years. She sells cameras, towels, shirts, blouses, and jeans. She sells her merchandise from home and by order, and she already has a good clientele. She has taken out several loans to maintain the business. She is currently requesting her sixth loan from the institution and it is for 20,000 HNL. She will use it to buy merchandise, such as jeans, cameras, towels, blouses, shirts, and t-shirts to add to her stock and sell, making the most of the end-of-year season. Her plan is to make the business grow so she can help her children.

loans.use: to buy jeans, cameras, towels, blouses, shirts, and t-shirts to add to her stock and sell, thereby making the most of the end-of-year season

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr:
Chantal âgée de 37 ans est née à kpalimé ville située à 120 kilomètres de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Chantal est revendeuse de pâtes dentifrices et habite le quartier Adidogomé.
Elle a commencé son activité en 2012 et s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé.
Chantal a un niveau de secondaire et sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 3 douzaines de pâte dentifrice afin d'augmenter stock et mieux vendre.
Le revenu de cette activité lui permettra d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants et de se soigner en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Chantal is 37 years old. She was born in Kpalimé, a city 120 kilometers from Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. Chantal resells toothpaste in the Adidogomé neighborhood.

She started her business in 2012 and buys her supplies twice a month in the Grand Market of Lomé. 

Chantal went to high school. She is asking for a loan to buy three dozen tubes of toothpaste in order to increase her stock and sell better.

The revenue from her business will allow her to secure her children's education and take care of her children if they get sick.

loans.use: to buy three dozen tubes of toothpaste.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de mochilas, camisetas y gorros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de mochilas, gorros y mochilas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mochilas, camisetas y gorros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to sell backpacks, t-shirts and hats. She wants to get ahead through this business. Her dream is to expand her business selling backpacks and hats. She is requesting the loan to buy backpacks, t-shirts and hats.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy backpacks, t-shirts and hats

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years, out of a corner in her house. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  

Overtime Hamida has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. However, she needs to provide for more customers. For this reason, Hamida needs to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

As such, Hamida has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR.  She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities

loans.name: Mwandia

texts.en:
Mwandia is a married woman. She has three children, all of whom attend school. Mwandia owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwandia has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood and charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 31,420 she wants to purchase 12 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials as flagstones to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, age 50, is a married woman. Her husband, also shown in the photo, has a business selling crockery to local people on his bicycle. He offers various types of plastic crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. He makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. To improve her husband’s business, Shehnaz contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will allow her husband to purchase more varieties of plastic crockery such as bowls, glasses, and plates in various sizes and designs to increase sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of plastic crockery, such as bowls, glasses, and plates in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of 6 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her area. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is a 39-year-old married woman, and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Kausar’s husband who is a driver by profession.  He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. Kausar's husband has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in a functional condition. 

For this reason, Kausar has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband.  It will allow him to replace tires and purchase new auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Kausar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to replace tires and purchase new auto spare parts for the vehicle.

loans.name: Elemina

texts.en:
Elemina is 57 years old, married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 4 children. She farms in Eldoret town, where she grows vegetables to sell. She has been in the farming business for 10 years. She also sells cereals and clothes. 

She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer, and more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her businesses, make more income, and be able to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 45-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business for many years with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo). She sells the milk in her area, and her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 4 children and is a dedicated mother who wants the best for her children. 

It’s her 6th year with Kashf Foundation. She has requested a loan of 50000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for milking.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman is 41 years old and married, and he has two children. One of them is 17 years old and in his first year of college, and the other is going to ninth grade at school. His wife is working in a preschool. The family is living in the Baki region, but 22 years ago they became Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from their home, which was in the city of Fuzuli.

Telman is a taxi driver. Winter is coming and he wants to buy new tires for his car. He needs a loan in the amount of 1100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to replace the tires. Telman is very thankful to the Kiva organization for their help.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his taxi

loans.name: Baluku

texts.en: Baluku is 38 years old and married with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has owned a general merchandise retail shop for eight years. Baluku  began the business in order to provide for the basic needs of his family. Baluku dreams of growing his business into a wholesale business, but is faced with the challenges of limited income, debtors, threats from thieves and high transport costs. He is a hard-working man and is requesting the loan to buy sugar, millet flour, rice, beans, maize flour, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, millet flour, rice, beans, maize flour, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 51 years old. She is married to James and together they have been blessed with three children, who are 12, 10 and 7 years old respectively. James is a farmer and hence provides additional income for his family.

Joan is a farmer as well, a business she has had for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 20,000.

She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 10,000 which she will use to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, manure and seedlings in preparation for planting.

With the anticipated profits, Joan will be able to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business and stable income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is 29 years old, married and a father of six children, living with his family in a rented house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. Anwer studied through secondary education, but he couldn't complete his studies because of the miserable conditions of his family. Now, he runs his own business selling groceries and food materials in a small grocery store in his area. That small grocery is the main source of income for his family. Anwar has had that business for more than one year. He started this business with a small amount of capital. Thanks to Anwar's hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed him to expand his sales volume. For the purpose of further developing his business, Anwar turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER to buy more goods and food materials for his grocery store in order to face all the demands of his customers.

Anwar hopes to provide his grocery store with all needed goods and items. He wants to open a saving account in the bank to make a secure future for his children.

loans.use: to buy more goods and food materials for his grocery store in order to face all the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is 58 years old and married. The man shown in the photo is Najma's husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Najma has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy new tires and some spare auto parts. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Najma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business and life.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare auto parts.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en: Sharifan is a 60-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son, who is also shown in the photo. Her son assists her by purchasing goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they make enough to meet their household expenses. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, grains, oil, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at their store. With this investment she aspires to increase her sales and her profits, with which she can improve her business substantially.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, grains, oil, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at their store.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 46-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread, laces and zippers to stitch up more dresses on time to increase her earnings for providing quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, laces and zippers to stitch up more dresses on time to increase her earnings for providing quality of life to her family.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina has successfully built her business manufacturing footballs with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more raw materials such as spools of thread, needles, rubber material and leather covers to increase her sales to more cities to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials to make footballs.

loans.name: Tehisuma-Nakpayili Group

texts.en:
Rubabatu is a 31-year-old hard-working woman from Nakpayili in the Northern region of Ghana. Rubabatu is married and has 6 children. She is the individual pictured with her hands on the milled rice in the basin.

Rubabatu is a member of a rice processing group that has been in business for the last 6 years. The name of the group is "Tehisuma-Nakpayili". She earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their parboiled rice processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local markets around Bimbilla and non-local markets.

Rubabatu and Tehisuma-Nakpayili have asked for a loan of GHS 5,400.00. Rubabatu’s share of the loan is GHS 400.00, which would be used to buy paddy rice for processing. She aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food and pay her children’s school fees.

Rubabatu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice for processing.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 55-year-old, hard-working woman who has four children. For the last two years, she has been providing tailoring service in her area. She is quite popular for her stitching skills. Safia’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over time, she has established a good clientele. In her 4th loan cycle, Safia has requested for a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of thread and laces. Safia is very thankful for her previous loans, and hopes that this loan will further support her financially.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of thread and laces.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael does a motorcycle transport business in Eldoret town and has been in this business for six years. He is 34 years old, married, and together with his spouse, has been blessed with five children. 

He will use this loan to buy a new motorcycle and thereby expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and expand his business. 

This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loan successfully. His future hopes are to have a prosperous business and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Wambua is a 44-year-old man, married to Annah, and blessed with four children. Wambua has been an agricultural farmer for a period of five years, earning himself an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month. Annah adds additional income to their family.

Wambua is now servicing his seventh loan of KES. 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy some pesticides for his farm and pay wages to his workers.

Wambua plans to use the profits he earns to pay school fees for his children, and hopes to be a successful businessman and grow in his business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his farm and pay wages to his workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of bicycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 42-year-old married woman. She has three children. For the past 10 years, she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase, along with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, health and clothing. 

In order to expand their earnings, Shameem has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy cattle for resale purposes, which ultimately helps in generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale purposes to generate more income for her family.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is 56 years old and married with seven children; three of her children are in school. Reynalda works very hard to provide for them.

Reynalda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Reynalda has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Reynalda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret used the previous loan to buy beer, soda and local brew to sell. She is a still a farmer at the same time she is running the bar. She faces the challenge of price fluctuation. Despite that, she hopes to have enough capital and a healthy family. Margret needs a loan to buy groundnuts for planting.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to plant

loans.name: Peligrina

texts.en:
Peligrina is 54 years old and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Peligrina has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy products and ingredients for her business.

Peligrina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Peligrina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy products and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is married and has been blessed with two children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges in her business. 

Kadzo is requesting 15,000 Kenyan shillings to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ermal

texts.en: Ermal, whose name in English is translated into "mountain fresh smell," is thanking all his lenders for helping him out through the previous loan. He is seeking their help again to add some more raw materials to his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy some more raw materials for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Engjellush

texts.en:
Engjellush is 47 and a married father of two children, 19 and 14 years old. He is applying for a loan in the amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek, which he will use to make repairs to their family home; they live in a region where the cold is very bitter and the snow has started already. Engjellush works for pay; he does welding and is photographed here at the shop; his wife works for pay as well in clothing manufacturing. 

Their family lives in a little town just off the city of Korca. In the beginning of the communist era this town did not exist; it was a marsh. With work from hundreds of volunteers from across the country a town was built with some buildings for new residents; they started planting sugar beets and a huge factory was built to produce sugar out of the beets. Nowadays, the factory has turned into a ruin and no sugar beets are planted anymore. The sugar is imported instead.

loans.use: to make basic repairs to his family home as the snow has already started in their town

loans.name: Norma  Maria

texts.es:
La socia Norma Maria se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y aceite.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower Norma Maria continues to work for a living in her grocery store. She sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She wants to get ahead through her business. She has been in it for 5 years now, and it is going very well. This borrower's dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is requesting this loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and oil. 

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and oil.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 41-year-old man married to Catherine who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  Patrick has been operating a retail business for a period of six years, earning an income of KES. 20,000 at the end of every month.

Patrick is now servicing his seventh loan of KES 85,000 and intends to use this amount to add more stock of sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, bread and milk to add to his stock, which is running out.

Patrick plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, bread, milk, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 48 years old and four of her children are in school.

Gina has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Gina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is 48 years old and married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Ezra is a dairy farmer who also earns a salary as additional income to earn a living. 

Ezra began the dairy farming business in order to look after his family. Ezra has a dream of expanding his dairy farming project and being the biggest milk supplier in Kasese. 

Ezra is faced with a challenge of pests and diseases, such such as foot and mouth disease and tsetse flies. 

Ezra wants money to buy dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman and has three children. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals-shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Beth dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 15,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat, maize, beans and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat, maize, beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bread, sausages, condiments, beverages, etc. to make hot dogs.  She also will buy cosmetics to offer cosmetology services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to help her father to complete and renovate the house.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 40-year-old man married to Orpha, who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with three children. Patrick has been a carpenter for 10 years, earning himself an income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.
 
Patrick is now servicing his second loan of 30,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy additional timber to use to make beds, cupboards and sofa sets for his customers.

The profits he earns will be used to expand his wife’s green grocery business and educate his children. He hopes to be a successful businessman and grow in his business.

loans.use: To buy additional timber to make beds, cupboards and sofa sets

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson used his previous loan to buy motorcycle tires for his motorcycle. He is still in transport and at the same time selling second hand clothes. He has a vision of turning his business of clothes into a big shop selling clothes. Dickson needs a loan to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start an agro-vet shop

loans.name: Fredy Amadeo

texts.es:
Fredy de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta  6° grado de educación básica, no continuo con sus estudios por estar lejos la escuela. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y son padres de una hija.  
 

Fredy el negocio es comprar y vender ganado durante la semana anda buscando quien vende y lo saca al mercado cada miércoles de la semana, anteriormente a los clientes les trataba solo dejando un principio; pero hoy no quieren vender así es como a recurrido a buscar préstamo para poder seguir en el negocio, tiene cuatro años de dedicarse de lleno.  Antes andaba con su papá quien le enseño y también se dedica a la agricultura siembra de granos básicos en alianza con un primo, así es que también salen a vender al mercado.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar ganado para reventa buscando obtener unos centavos de ganancia.

El sueño de Fredy es que en unos diez años trabajar libre y hacer lo que siempre ha pensado una casa digna de poder vivir, pero está seguro que se puede lograr tiene que trabajar fuerte y ahorrar el dinero.
texts.en:
Fredy, 22, has a sixth grade education and was unable to continue because of the distance from the school.  His wife is a homemaker and they have a daughter.

Fredy's business is buying and selling cattle.  During the week he scouts around to see who is selling at market every Wednesday.  He used to be able to buy making a downpayment only but nowadays no one wants to sell that way.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to continue his business which he started full time four years ago.  He used to work with his father who taught him and he also works in agriculture growing basic grains together with his cousin.  They also sell at market.

The loan he is requesting is to buy cattle for resale in order to obtain a small profit.  Fredy's dream is to work another ten years and do everything he can to build a decent house to live in.  He is sure that he can do it through hard work and by saving money.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell for a small profit.

loans.name: Niyaz

texts.en:
