Niyaz is a master. He has been married for 21 years and has two children. One of them is studying in the second course of college and another was graduated from school and learned to be a teacher. The family is living in the Baku region, but 22 years ago they became Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from their home, which was Khocali city.

Niyaz lives in the Baku region. He has been in the construction business for 17 years and loves his job. 

Niyaz has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat) to buy new materials.

Niyaz says, “Dear Kiva organization and dear lenders, you helped me a lot.”

loans.use: to buy new materials

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 33 years old, married, and together with his spouse, has been blessed with one child. He runs a hotel (a primitive restaurant) and has been in this business for four years.

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, maize flour and cereals for use in his hotel. This will enable him to serve more customers and thereby, get more income in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land. 

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loan successfully. His future hopes are to expand his business and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize flour and cereals for use in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a small refrigerator to keep water, drinks, and some foods cold.

loans.name: Lirika

texts.en:
This is Lirika and Maxim, her husband. They are members of the ethnic Egyptian Albanian community and they resell used items, mostly thrifty clothes to some other towns to the southern Albanians. They have been photographed in their home though, due to the fact that at the moment they do not have any items to resell since they are applying for a loan to stock up on such inventory. While Lirika sells the used clothes, Maxim works for pay in a nearby high school as a night man. They have two children who are 19 and 16 and go to school.

Kindly note that they chose to have a photograph taken together. They request an amount of 250,000 Albanian lek and this will be their first loan with the institution.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory of secondhand clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business by buying pork, which will allow her to increase her income so that she can provide her son with a better quality of life

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Analyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Agua Vida De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUA VIVA DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sofía es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de mantas, venta de frutas, servicio telefónico, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sofía es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su cuñada, uniendo capitales de trabajo para minimizar costos y lograr generar mayor ganancias. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Agua Viva de Los Andes Community Bank is beginning its 29th loan cycle with Pro Mujer. It is part of the Los Andes group. There are nine members in the community bank; Sra. Sofia is president of the board of directors. The members have a variety of businesses including selling clothes, selling blankets, selling fruit, running a telephone business, and selling food.

The loan they  are seeking will benefit these small business owners like Sra. Sofia. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of one of the institution's advisors who visited her house. Currently Sofia runs a business selling clothes jointly with her sister-in-law so as to minimize costs and generate greater income.

She plans to use the money to buy clothing in bulk from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then resell it from her stall. The income she earns will allow her to help her family financially. She is married and has four children.

When asked what she most enjoys about Pro Mujer, Sofia responds that she likes learning about health.

loans.use: Buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business, which she hopes will enable it to grow and make it possible for her to better provide for her children

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 72-year-old hardworking woman married to Pius, who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with seven children. Josephine has been operating a retail shop for a period of ten years, earning herself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Josephine is now servicing her sixth loan of KES 40,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to add more stock of rice, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and bread to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Josephine plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and be able to further their education to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, bread, milk, wheat flour, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a 28-year-old single lady with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a salon which she runs seven days a week. She faces challenges of limited capital; however, she hopes to expand her business to also include male salon services. Doreen needs a loan to buy a dryer and some oils for the salon.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and some oils for the salon.

loans.name: Nueva Ilución Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ILUCIÓN” iniciará el vigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosario es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de golosinas, venta de ropa, tejido y venta de mantillas de alpaca, tienda de barrio, taller de joyería, venta de peluches.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosario es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de joyería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su padre, desde su niñez, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse para emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de oro y plata por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las minas del departamento de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Nueva Ilución Community Bank is beginning its 20th loan cycle with Pro Mujer. It is part of the Santiago II group. There are nine members in the community bank; Sra. Rosario is president of the board of directors. The members have a variety of businesses including selling food, selling candy, selling clothing, weaving and selling alpaca shawls, and selling soft toys.

The loan they  are seeking will benefit these small business owners like Sra. Rosario. She joined Pro Mujer six years ago at the invitation of a friend who is one of the institution's clients. Currently Rosario runs a jewelry workshop, a skill she learned from her father when she was young. As time went on she decided to run her own independent business.

She plans to use the money to buy gold and silver from the local mines in La Paz and then sell the jewelry from her stall. The income she earns will allow her to help her family financially. She is single and has two children.

When asked what she most enjoys about Pro Mujer, Rosario responds that she likes the mentoring, the training, and the access to loans.

loans.use: Buy gold and silver at wholesale prices

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is 32 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rhea has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Rhea has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Rhea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEBASTIAN” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roxana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mariscos, venta de comida, venta de prendas de vestir, venta de helados, servicio de transporte, venta de carne de pollo y res.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Roxana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de forma independiente y por necesidad, ya que ella requería contar con ingresos propios para apoyar a su familia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Sebastian" communal bank is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer and its Santiago II regional office. The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors that has Roxana as president. The members have different businesses including: selling seafood, selling meals, selling clothes, ice-cream sales, transport services, and selling red meat and chicken.

This loan will benefit micro-entrepreneurs in Roxana's group. Roxana herself says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago following an invitation from a promoter who visited her at her home. Roxana currently has a business selling meals. Roxana says that she learned her trade on her own and because she needed to earn an income to support her family.

This loan will be used to increase merchandise by buying groceries in bulk from the markets of the city of La Paz. She will then sell these items. This work allows Roxana to earn an income to support her family financially. Roxana is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Roxana says that she likes the advice centre offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 70 years old and widowed with two children. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and canned goods. Lourdes has been in this business for 35 years. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and canned goods

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 31 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as beverages, canned goods, and milk. Ailyn has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as beverages, canned goods, milk.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a 39-year-old man married to Joyce, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children.  Jonathan has been operating a retail shop for five years, earning an income of 8,000 KES monthly.

Jonathan is now servicing his fifth loan of 10,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to purchase more stocks of sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat to sell to his customers.

He plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para comprar 7 qq de abono para el cultivo de maíz y 2 cerdos para fortalecer más su negocio; de esta manera seguirá teniendo ingresos para subsistir con su familia y cancelar su nueva deuda.
El crédito anterior ha sido de beneficio porque cubrió los gastos de recolección de cosecha y transporte de la misma, obteniendo así mejores ingresos por que pudo cubrir a tiempo las demandas de sus clientes, su familia se mantiene y la situación económica es más estable.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan to buy 7ha of fertilizer for growing corn, and two pigs, which will further strengthen his business. This way he will continue to have an income to sustain his family and repay this loan. 

The previous loan was beneficial, as it covered the costs of collecting the harvest and the transportation of it.  This allowed him to obtain a greater income as he was able to meet the demands of his customers. He is able to maintain his family and his economic situation is more stable.

loans.use: to buy 7ha of fertilizer for growing corn, and two pigs, which will further strengthen his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 51 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with five children. She runs a beauty salon business in Eldoret. She has been in this business for 21 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more salon equipment, such as blow dryers, towels, hair clippers, hair chemicals and shampoo to use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to expand her business. 

This is her fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya; she repaid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business, to be successful, and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more salon equipment and hair products.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AZUCENAS” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: flete de vajillas para acontecimientos, venta de chamarras, venta de chompas, venta de carne, venta de cosméticos, venta de golosinas, librería, trenzado de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un negocio que tenía la dueña del domicilio donde vivía, posteriormente, con un pequeño capital, decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
"AZUCENAS" community association is starting its seventh cycle in Pro Mujer.  This group is part of the Focal Point of the Andes, is comprised of eight members, and is headed by a board, of which Rosmery is President. Members of the community association have created various businesses including: providing plates for events, selling jackets, sweaters, meat, cosmetics, or candy, running a bookstore, or braiding rugs. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit their microbusinesses, including Rosmery's. She says that she has been a member of  Pro Mujer for four years. She joined because of the invitation of a supporter of Pro Mujer who went to visit her at her home. Today, she has a grocery store.  Rosmery states that she learned how to run this business from a business that a previous landlady had.  Later, with a little bit of capital, she decided to start an independent enterprise. 

The loan Rosmery is now taking out is in order to increase capital to buy groceries in bulk.  The groceries, to be acquired from wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, will be subsequently sold in her retail space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she lives in a domestic partnership and has two children. 

When Rosmery is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health services and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Lino

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, de los cuales unos están estudiando nivel básico y el mayor está en bachillerato; aprendió de su padre a trabajar en el campo, cuando inicio a trabajar de manera independiente adquirió más experiencia en el cultivo de maíz, maicillo y ayote, poco a poco ha logrado incorporar la crianza de ganado y ofrecer el servicio de trasporte en camión.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas, reparaciones del camión y vitaminas para el ganado, desarrollara mejor sus diferentes actividades económicas, espera tener una cosecha abundante, mantener su unidad de transporte en buen estado para atraer nuevos clientes y dar un mejor cuido a su ganado.
Don José sueña con tener una mejor situación económica, cancelar su deuda y compartir con su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and four children, of which some are in elementary school and the eldest is in high school.  José learned from his father to work in the field.  When José stated to work independently, he acquired more experience in the cultivation of maize, sorghum and squash, and he has slowly managed to incorporate the raising of livestock and offering transportation by truck into his business. 

This loan will be invested in agricultural goods, truck repairs and vitamins for livestock.  It will better development his various business activities.  José is hoping to have an abundant harvest, to maintain his vehicle in a good condition to attract new customers and provide better care for his livestock. 

Jose dreams of having a better economic situation, pay off his debt and provide his family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural goods, truck repairs and vitamins for livestock and to better develop his various business activities

loans.name: Betel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BETEL” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medicina natural, tienda de abarrotes, venta de tucumanas, servicio de transporte, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medicina natural; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de forma independiente comprando sus medicamentos con un pequeño capital obtenido de un trabajo paralelo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de medicina natural por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es divorciada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "BETEL" started its seventh round in Pro Mujer as part of the Focus Center of Santiago II.  It is comprised of eight members and is headed by a board, of which Mrs Justina is the President. The businesses that are members of the community association carry out various actitivities, including: selling natural medicines, running a grocery store, selling empanadas, providing transport services, selling baby clothes and selling fruit. 

The loan would benefit the micro-entrepreneurs of which Mrs Justina is a member.  Mrs Justina says that she became a member of Pro Mujer four years ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the association. 

Mrs Justina currently has a business selling natural medicines.  She learned this business independently, purchasing her medicines with a small amount of capital raised by working in a second job.

The loan will be used to increase her merchandise, by allowing her to purchase natural medicine wholesale from the markets in the city of La Paz, then selling these to her customers. 

This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is divorced and has six children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the clinic offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale natural medicines

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de quince y diez años y dos hijas de diecisiete y ocho años, su negocio es la venta de café, refrescos y crema chantillí con gelatina.
Ella es honesta, constante, trabajadora, emprendedora y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en un mercado de su zona, un lugar caracterizado por la aglomeración de comerciantes de fruta que traen sus productos del interior del país.
Marina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, viste a la moda y usa ropa típica (manta, sombrero y pollera) para las fiestas, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que es policía y viaja constantemente, y junto a sus cuatro hijos; todos asisten a la escuela. Su experiencia en el negocio es de casi toda su vida porque lo heredó de su mamá, hace cinco años que ella se hizo cargo del trabajo porque su mamá ya está muy cansada. Su negocio es la venta de desayuno por las mañanas, postres a medio día y té a media tarde; por las mañanas a partir de las ocho se aproxima a los puestos de venta de vendedores de la zona en todas las áreas y les deja una taza de té o café con un pan acompañado de una rodaja de queso, luego aproximadamente a las once de la mañana realiza el mismo recorrido recogiendo toda su vajilla. Más tarde después de almuerzo recorre los mismos lugares ofreciendo postres como; gelatina, crema chantillí y refrescos, para retornar a las seis de la tarde y realizar la misma rutina que en la mañana. Esta actividad la realiza de lunes a domingo porque el comercio no descansa en este lugar, eso hace que el negocio sea rentable y tenga éxito.
Su puesto de venta se encuentra en una esquina de difícil acceso dentro del mercado, el cual no cuenta con techo y eso también le resta clientela. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos desde que se hizo cargo de su actividad. Su sueño es mejorar su puesto de venta o tal vez cambiarlo por otro mediante compra o transferencia. Ella desea realizar la compra de calaminas para techar su puesto y poder trabajar de mejor manera.
Es por esos motivos que Marina solicita un préstamo para arreglar su puesto de venta y trabajar bajo techo.
texts.en:
39-year old Marina is married and has two sons aged 15 and 10 and two daughters aged 17 and 8. She earns her living selling coffee, soft drinks, and jello with chantilly cream. She is honest, steady, hardworking, enterprising and very responsible. Her place of work is the local market, a place where many fruit sellers bring their produce from the interior of the country. 

Marina is dark-complexioned and has long dark braids. She dresses fashionably but also wears traditional clothing (shawl, hat, skirt) on festive occasions. Her native language is Aymara but she speaks Spanish for work. Her husband is a policeman who travels a lot. She has four children, all of whom attend school.

Marina has many years of business experience as she inherited the business from her mother. Five years ago she took charge completely as her mother was very weary. The business is selling breakfasts in the morning, desserts at lunch time, and tea in the middle of the afternoon. At 8 am she goes round to all the sellers in the area and leaves them a cup of tea or coffee with bread and a slice of cheese. Then at approximately 11am she follows the same route to pick up her dishes. Later after lunch she goes to the same places selling desserts like jello, chantilly cream, and soft drinks. Then at 6 pm she does the same as in the morning,

Marina follows this schedule every day of the week as work never stops in this part of town. It means that her business is profitable and successful. Her stall is located in a difficult to access corner inside the market. It has no roof.

This is her first loan since she took over the business from her mother. Marina's dream is to improve her stall or perhaps even change it either by buying another one or exchanging it. She wishes to use the loan money buy sheeting to put a roof on her stall so she can work under shelter.

loans.use: To put a roof over her stall so she can work under cover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a bigger griddle to be able to make a larger quantity of tortillas, and 6 quintals (276 kg) of corn to have raw material.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, planea mejorar el inventario que tiene en su tienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar aceite, granos básicos, boquitas, dulces, azúcar, sal, etc., cubrirá las nuevas demandas de sus clientes.
El préstamo anterior fue de utilidad para José, pues compro insumos para la tienda y pudo vender pólvora para  la época navideña, el margen de ganancia ha sido mayor y ha mejorado el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
José, planning to improve the inventory he has in his store, has made the decision to apply for a new loan to buy oil, grains, snacks, sweets, sugar, salt, etc., to meet the new demands of his customers. 

The previous loan was useful for José, because he bought supplies for the store and was able to sell fireworks for the holiday season.  His profit margin has increased and has improved the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy oil, grains, snacks, sweets, sugar, salt, etc., to  meet the new demands of his customers.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis es un joven muy trabajador que siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, es soltero y vive en Parcona junto a sus seres queridos. Desde hace varios años trabaja en un taller de mecánica, aprendió poco a poco ya que al no tener una economía estable en su casa no pudo estudiar una profesión, pero esto no fue un impedimento para él, por el contrario es una mayor motivación para que cada día pueda salir adelante porque quiere brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia. Lo que más le gusta hacer es escuchar música, porque piensa que con la música pueden expresar muchos sentimientos y es una manera de relajarse.
Luis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio para su casa, de esta manera sentirá mayor comodidad al momento de dormir y así continuará esforzándose para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a hardworking young man who always strives to get the best for his family.  He is single and lives in Parcona with his loved ones. 

For several years he has worked at a mechanic.  He has been learning bit by bit, as his family does not have a stable income, so he could not study a profession.  However, this was not an impediment to him, on the contrary, it is a major motivation.  Every day he wants to get ahead because he wants to provide the best for his family. 

What he likes to do the most is listen to music, because he thinks that with music, one can express many feelings and it is a way to relax. 

Louis is grateful to Kiva lenders because the support they have given will enable him to buy a bedroom set for his home.  This will allow him to feel comfort at bedtime, which will enable him to continue to strive to improve the quality of life of his family

loans.use: to buy a bedroom set for his home

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 62 years old. He is married to Margaret and together they have been blessed with five children, ages 37 to 22 years.

Joseph is a painter and he loves it. This has been his core business for the last 11 years; he earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES. Joseph has requested his 4th loan with VisionFund Kenya of 10,000 KES which he will use to buy paint and new, quality painting brushes.

Joseph successfully paid back his previous loans.

His hopes and his dreams for the future are to educate his school-going child and secure a house for his family to avoid paying rent.

loans.use: to buy paint and new, quality painting brushes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an amount of clothes for resale

loans.name: Chengo

texts.en:
Chengo is married with seven school-going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

Chengo has operated a goat selling business for the past two years. She sells at the market and to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add some female baby sheep to his existing herd

loans.name: Gjon

texts.en:
A loan of 250,000 ALL that Gjon is seeking from you will be used to buy kitchenware for his bar-cafe and to stock up on inventory items. He only had a bar-café before and recently he added the kitchen. He has a dairy cow as well and sells only 2 kg of raw milk/day to his neighbors; the rest of the milk is used for the family. Gjon also has some twelve dynym of agricultural land, where he plants mainly corn and wheat and sells fresh produce. 

Gjon is 37 and a father of two; his children are 2 and 7 years old. His parents live with his family as well. 

Gjon’s village, under the Communist era, became known for the greenhouses and animal stables; a high number of both existed yet, nowadays, they are not functioning.

He's been photographed with his 2-year-old baby girl outside their home (because on the day of interview his older child had a temperature, thus he had stayed home to look after him).

loans.use: to buy kichenware for his newly added restaurant and to stock up on inventory items

loans.name: Fredy Arturo

texts.es:
Fredy, tiene una venta de cosméticos, cremas dentales, lociones y otros productos de uso personal, su negocio cuenta con tres años de estar en el mercado, con el tiempo ha ido mejorando el inventario de su negocio, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.; Fredy está acompañado, solamente vive con su compañera de vida, aún no tiene hijos.
Con el crédito Fredy invertirá en lociones, cosméticos, cremas corporales, etc., con esta compra tendrá nuevos productos a la disposición de sus clientes y estará preparado para la temporada en la que mejoran las ventas, espera tener mayores ganancias y cumplir con el pago de las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
La visión de Fredy es crecer con su negocio, para tener una fuente de ingresos con los que mejorará el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Fredy has a business selling cosmetics, toothpastes, lotions and other products for personal use.  His business has been in the market for three years. Over time, he has improved the inventory of his business.  His hours are from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm.  Fredy is in a relationship: he lives alone with his female life partner and they have no children yet. 

With this loan, Fredy will invest in lotions, cosmetics, body creams, etc.  With this purchase, he will have new products to offer his customers and will be ready for the busy sales season.  He expects to have higher profits and to be able to make the loan repayments. Fredy's vision is to grow with his business, to have a source of income to improve the family standard of living.

loans.use: to invest in lotions, cosmetics, body creams, etc. to have new products to offer his customers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy clothes for sale, approaching the Christmas season when there is high demand. She is a 31-year-old, single female with 2 children. She sells clothes along with a side job of brick-laying. She started the business to earn a living for her family. Jane wishes to build a permanent house for her family's well-being but competition and poor roads hinder her business, especially during transportation.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Herminia is 53 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Herminia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Herminia requested a 30,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment needed for her business.

Herminia has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment needed for her business

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Chantha’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Titukule Group

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman. She is 20 years old and supports her family by selling beans in the market. She has three children who go to school and her husband is a farmer. Margret started her business four years ago and currently is requesting this loan to purchase beans in bulk to reach mare customers in her village.

Since she started accessing loans, she has seen herself making more profits and she hopes to expand her business by selling beans at a wholesale price. Margret also wants to meet her family's basic needs without her husband's involvement. As a woman she is proud to be self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy beans

loans.name: Maran's Group

texts.en: Maran’s group live in a rural village in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Maran makes a living cultivating rice and planting watermelons to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these individuals safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en:
Mutinda is a 42-year-old man married to Ruth, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children.  Mutinda has been running a retail shop for six years, earning himself an income of 10,000 KES every month.

Mutinda is now servicing his sixth loan of 25,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy bread, cooking fat, maize flour, wheat flour, milk and rice to sell to his customers.

He plans to use the anticipated income to boost his wife's beauty shop business and hopes to open a general store within his hometown in the near future.

loans.use: To buy bread, milk, cooking fat, maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, beer and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marites has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Marites has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, cosmetics and other items

loans.name: Ana Estela

texts.es:
Ana, utilizo el crédito anterior para mejorar la variedad de ropa y cosméticos que ofrece a sus clientes, la situación financiera ha mejorado un poco, su grupo familiar se mantiene igual pero con un mejor estilo de vida.
Ana está percibiendo un aumento en las demandas de sus clientes por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar nuevos estilos de ropa y cosméticos, mantendrá un inventario mejor surtido para satisfacer  los gustos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana used her previous loan to improve the variety of clothing and cosmetics for her customers.  Her financial situation has improved a little and her family is the same but enjoys a better lifestyle.

Ana sees an increase in customer demand so she is in need of a new loan to buy new styles of clothing and cosmetics to keep her inventory better stocked for her customers.

loans.use: To buy new styles of clothing and cosmetics to satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Sarorng's Group

texts.en: Sarorng’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sarorng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Maria Adina

texts.es:
María, requiere de más capital para comprar vestidos, pantalones, blusas, camisas, etc., surtirá su negocio de nuevas prendas de vestir para poder competir mejor en el mercado y satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
El impacto que tuvo el crédito anterior en su negocio ha sido positivo, ya que ha mantenido productos del gusto de sus clientes, las ventas y ganancias han mejorado. Mantiene el mismo núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
María is in need of more capital to buy dresses, pants, blouses, shirts, etc. to stock her business with new clothing in order to compete better in the market and satisfy customer demand.

The impact on her business from the previous loan has been positive since she was able to meet customer demand and improve sales and profits.  Her family situation is the same.

loans.use: To buy new styles of dresses, pants, blouses, shirts, etc. to compete better in the market.

loans.name: Phal's Group

She also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
