In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Vanessa es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene cuatro hijos de diez, nueve, dos años y uno de ocho meses, su negocio es la venta de refrescos.
Ella es responsable, trabajadora, emprendedora, buena madre y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por su clima extremadamente tropical y el crecimiento constante del comercio en todas las áreas por inmigrantes del lugar y del occidente del país.
Vanessa es de tez  morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (la primera de la izquierda, blusa azul, pantalón jean). Debido a la necesidad de mejorar la calidad de su familia ampliando su negocio, conformó una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida snack, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería, tienda de vídeos, venta de comida y artesanía en yeso, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus actividades. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos en los dos años que lleva realizando esta actividad. Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus cuatro hijos que colaboran en el trabajo transportando las cajas vacías y llenas, los dos mayores estudian en la escuela. Su negocio es la venta de gaseosas que debido al clima cálido del lugar es un negocio exitoso y rentable, labor que cumple desde la mañana hasta la noche, de lunes a domingo. Su sueño es tener una tienda completa. Ella desea realizar la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para abastecer e iniciar su emprendimiento como tienda de barrio. Es por esos motivos que Vanessa solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para iniciar su negocio como tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a 31 year old woman.  She lives with her partner and has four children of ten, nine, two years and one of eight months. The two oldest are enrolled in school. Her business is selling cold drinks. She is responsible, hardworking, enterprising, and a good mother.  She does her work in the '3000 Plan' zone, a place characterized by its extremely tropical climate and the steady growth of trade in all sectors due to local immigrants and immigrants from the west of the country. 

Vanessa is of dark complexion, medium build, and has long black hair (first on the left, blue blouse, jean shorts). Her first language is Spanish, and she also knows Guarani from her family. Due to the need to improve the quality of life for her family, she is expanding her business.  Vanessa joined a banking group composed of people with businesses such as: selling snack food, sportswear, or food, a neighborhood store, a butcher, a video store, and making plaster - works.  The group is requesting a loan in order to make their businesses thrive. This is the first sequence of loans in the two years Vanessa has been in business. Her life consists of a partner who works in construction and their four children who help out with the business by carrying the empty and filled boxes.  Her business selling soft drinks, due to the warm climate of the place, is successful and profitable. This work takes place from morning to night, Monday to Sunday. Her dream is to have a complete shop. She wants to buy staple foods to supply and start a neighborhood store. It is for these reasons that Vanessa is requesting a loan for the purchase of staple foods to start her business as a neighborhood store.

loans.use: to buy staple foods to supply and start a neighborhood store.

loans.name: Estrellas De Paz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE PAZ” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jahel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de comida, venta de repuestos de computadoras, venta de calzados, servicios de llenado de formularios de impuestos, tejido de mantas, venta de cosméticos, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jahel es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien realiza el mismo negocio, es por ello que como ya conoce la dinámica decide implementar su negocio independientemente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es divorciada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ESTRELLAS DE PAZ" is beginning its seventh Pro Mujer loan cycle through the social center Los Andes.  The group consists of nine members and the president of the board of directors is Jahel.  The members are involved in different businesses, including food, computer spare parts sales, shoe sales, tax filing services, blanket weaving, cosmetics sales and meat sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners, including Jahel who says this is her fourth year as a member of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation through a representative of the institution who visited her at home.  The business she is currently involved in is cosmetic sales which she learned from her mother who is in the same business.  So, she already knows the dynamics and decided to establish herself independently.

The loan she is requesting now is to buy wholesale cosmetics from distributors in the city of La Paz, which she will later sale at her stand.  This type of work allows her to earn resources to support her family economically.  She is divorced and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cosmetics.

loans.name: Tet's Group

texts.en: Tet’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Tet makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a construction worker and factory labourer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is married and has six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruit and coconuts for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Chheng's Group

texts.en: Chheng’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chheng makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family. In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Mymie

texts.en:
Mymie has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mymie is 27 years old and one of her children is in school.

Mymie has a feed vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

Mymie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mymie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Sony's Group

texts.en: Sony’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sony makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en: Chanda’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanda makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker and a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mwachakanda

texts.en:
Mwachakanda is married and blessed with children. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical expenses. 

Mwachakanda operates a clothes selling business, selling women and gents' suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes operators to be her major challenges. 

With the 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business.

loans.name: Nthetsa Umphawi Group

texts.en:
Esnart is 29 years old and divorced. She has three children and an orphan who go to school. She owns a market stall selling tomatoes and samousa and is requesting this loan to purchase bread flour to produce samousa and tomatoes in bulk to attract more customers.

Her ambition is to use any profit generated to meet her family's basic needs and to be able to send her children to private school. Since she started accessing loans, she has seen herself running a sustainable business and in the future, she believes she will buy a plot and start building a house for her family

loans.use: To buy flour and tomatoes

loans.name: Khin's Group

texts.en: Khin’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Khin makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of the members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, es un agricultor dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos, crianza de ganado y cerdos, vive en compañía de su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en edades de 12, 10 y 1 año, él tiene la responsabilidad de cubrir los gastos de su hogar; el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, desde hace 10 años lo desempeña de manera independiente con ayuda de su familia, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., en este momento está administrando muy bien su negocio.
Comprará herbicidas, insecticidas y abono para mejorar el desarrollo del maíz y frijol que tiene sembrado, espera tener una cosecha abundante, con la que dará mejor alimentación a su familia y comercializar otra parte, los riesgos que implica está actividad son las amenazas de plagas y los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas.
Su visión es continuar trabajando para mantener su negocio rentable, darles a sus hijos una vida más digna y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Manuel is a farmer and grows basic grains and raises cattle and pigs.  He lives with his life partner and their three sons, ages 12, 10 and 1 year old.  He has the responsibility of paying for the household expenses.  He learned the trade from his parents and has been working independently for ten years with the help of his family.  His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.  For now he is managing his business very well.

He plans to buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer to improve development of his corn and bean crops in order to obtain an abundant harvest.  This will allow him to feed his family better and sell the rest.  The risks involved in the business are the threat of crop disease and the high cost of farm supplies.

His goal is to continue working to keep his business profitable and to give his children a decent lifestyle and better future.

loans.use: To buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer to improve development of his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: This is Fares’s second loan from Ryada. His previous loan helped him to develop his business and had a positive outcome. He was able to build a barn for his animals. Today, Fares needs this loan to repair his house after the Gaza war. This will help his family after they use the UN school as a shelter. He wants to rebuild the kitchen, install pipelines, and buy glass and planks for renovating his home.

loans.use: to repair his house after the Gaza war

loans.name: Karla Johana

texts.es: Karla de 27 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 9 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante apoyada de su compañero de vida, quien le apoya con la economía del hogar gracias a su trabajo de zapatero en un local del mercado municipal. Además, ella se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Karla sabe que su vivienda es bastante pequeña y que sus hijas van creciendo y necesitan su propia espacio, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de construir un cuarto en su vivienda, con el cual se pueda vivir un poco más cómodos, pero Karla no cuenta con el financiamiento que dicha construcción necesita, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Karla, 27, lives in her own home with her life partner and their two daughters, ages 9 and 3.  She is a woman who is always seeking a way to get ahead supported by her partner who helps with household expenses thanks to his work as a cobbler at the local municipal market.  She earns a living sewing for a company near her town.

Karla knows her house is fairly small and that her daughters are growing and need more space.  Therefore, she has made the decision to build another room so they can live more comfortably.  But Karla does not have enough resources for the project so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his oil palm trees and cocoa trees.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and widowed with five children. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, beverages, etc.

Rosita has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, etc

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 49 years old and has three children. Elma is a married woman and one of her children is in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Elma requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elma has been in this business for 30 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosana is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosana has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and requested a 4,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fruits to sell.

Rosana has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 24 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. .

She has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es:
Sabas, necesita un nuevo financiamiento para seguir trabajando y generando ingresos que necesita para salir adelante con su familia, comprara cerdos para engorde y pagara mano de obra para realizar la limpia de maleza en la milpa, podrá vender a un mejor precio los cerdos y cuidar su cultivo para tener una mayor productividad de maíz.
Con la ayuda de los préstamos Sabas tiene un negocio más amplio, su familia tiene una mejor alimentación, educación, vestuario y puedo resarcir su deuda sin problemas.
texts.en:
Sabas is in need of a new loan to continue his work and generate income so his famliy can get ahead.  He will buy pigs to raise and hire workers to clean the cornfields.  He wants to get better prices for the pigs and care for his crops in order to obtain more corn production.

With the help of the loan, Sabas will expand his business and give his family better food, education and clothing, and pay off debt without problems.

loans.use: To buy pigs and hire help to clean the cornfields.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 42-year-old married female, living in Masindi, Uganda. She is responsible for taking care of three children, ages 15, 17 and 12. 

She sells cosmetics alongside clothes for income generation. She started the business to earn a living and cater for her family. Joyce has hopes of expanding her business but high transport costs hinder her business.

She will use the loan to buy cosmetics, like jelly, and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, like jelly, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He has a vehicle-for-transport business that earns him income to support his family. He wants a loan to buy another car for transport.

He wishes to educate his children until university but bad roads and competition affect his business.

loans.use: to buy another car for his transport business

loans.name: Sinclair

texts.en: Sinclair is a carver from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African wood masks and sculptures. He would like to purchase materials for his workshop, including wood, sand paper, stains, and polish. Sinclair has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "As I was growing up, I used to carve some in school, but little did I know that I would one day become a woodcarver. I moved to Accra to live with my dad. At the time, my father was into carving and had been asking to me to join him in his workshop, but I wasn't interested. I once visited him at work and he asked me to help with some masks. To his surprise, I finished earlier than his apprentice and did a good job. My dad sold the masks and gave me a commission. That convinced me. I quit my job as a gardener and started assisting my father. Eventually, I went to a master carver to learn how to carve other items and also to improve on my skills. In my designs I look out for accuracy and good imagination and creativity. I get inspiration from my environment and the people around me. My hope and plans for the future include establishing a workshop in my hometown and starting a tree farm and a fish farm to help the youth there have a source of income." "I am so thankful to you all for your assistance through this microcredit." Use the link below to view Sinclair's hand-carved African wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8792

loans.use: to purchase materials for his workshop, including wood, sand paper, stains, and polish

loans.name: Marilia

texts.en: Marilia is an artisan from Brazil who specializes in leather jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather and metal clasps for her designs. Marilia has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is her story: "My designs are meant to be used at all times of day and they are chic, original and feminine accessories. I try to give meaning to my materials by maximizing their forms, textures and translucency so that each piece is versatile, well finished and sophisticated. I call my line 'bijoulherias' (from the Portuguese 'bijouteria' and 'joalheria'). This term came to me in a dream and it describes my designs as a blend of custom and fancy jewelry." "This microcredit is very important to me, as it will provide the capital and peace of mind needed to create new designs and, hopefully, increase my sales." Use the link below to view Marilia's leather jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3284

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather and metal clasps for her designs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay processing fees for her thesis.

loans.name: Wendy Maricela

texts.es: Wendy de 25 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 14 años de edad y su madre de 40 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace 4 años se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir, en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es gracias a ese trabajo que ha logrado sostener la economía de su hogar y apoyar a su madre con los gastos económicos ya que vive con ellas. Wendy es una mujer responsable que siempre está viendo la manera de dar lo mejor a su familia por lo que ha tomado la decisión de encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Wendy, 25, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 14-year-old daughter and 40-year-old mother.  She is a single lady and has been working as a seamstress for four years making clothing at a company near her town.  Thanks to her work she has been able to support the household economy and support her mother who lives with her.

Wendy is a responsible woman who is always looking for ways to give her family the best she can.  She has decided to put down a concrete floor on the porch of her house and is in need of a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel, and pay labor costs for the project.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel, and pay labor costs to put down a concrete floor on the porch of her house.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela, de 38 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella desea ser independiente y comenzar a ganarse la vida con la venta de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros en distintos almacenes y clientes del municipio de Puerto Boyacá.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para el de sus hijos, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y accesorios de este modo aprovechar las ofertas y descuentos por compras al por mayor.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables para su familia.
texts.en:
Marisela, 38 years old, is very clear about what she wants for her life and is determined to succeed and have a good life. 

She wants to be independent and to start making a living by selling assorted merchandise such as apparel, accessories such as wallets, and some cosmetics, among other things, at various stores and to customers in the municipality of Puerto Boyacá. 

She wants to start this business because of the desire to find the resources needed for her support and to support her children, in addition to helping with expenses at home. She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman. 

Marisela is requesting a loan to buy a wide selection of wholesale clothing and accessories so as to take advantage of offers and discounts for bulk purchases. 

She hopes to progress as an entrepreneur and have more stable income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a wide selection of wholesale clothing and accessories so as to take advantage of offers and discounts for bulk purchases.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una veterana de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Sincelejo con su esposo y 4 hijos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la compra y venta de mercancía como ropa y otras mercancías. 

Ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y cuando un cliente le hace un pedido siempre procura por atenderlo de la mejor manera posible.

Manifiesta que es un negocio muy lucrativo y sencillo de realizar para su edad.

Ella solicita un préstamo para compra de una vitrina, mercancía como ropa  compra de pescado y queso para iniciar con la venta de estos productos.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para la educación y sostenimientos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is a veteran of a thousand battles she has lived through in the course of her life. She lives in the town of  Sincelejo with her husband and 4 children.

She is a very hardworking woman and for some time she has been working in the business of buying and selling merchandise such as clothes and other products. 

She is a mobile seller of her products and when a client makes a request she always procures what they want so as to serve them in the best way possible.

It is a very lucrative business and easy to carry out for someone of her age.

She is asking for the loan to buy a display cabinet as well as merchandise like clothing. She also wants to use it to buy fish and cheese in order to start selling these products.

The loan will give her the opportunity to capitalize on her business and will give a considerable boost to her occupation, allowing her to get resources for her children's education and upkeep.

loans.use: buy a display cabinet, merchandise like clothing, and also fish and cheese in order to begin selling these products.

loans.name: Martha Jacoba

texts.es: la señora Martha es madre de tres hijos, de estos ninguno depende de ella, es comerciante desde hace 14 años, tiene un pequeño negocio en su domicilio del viejo, vende de todo un poco , verduras, bisuterías, caramelos, chicles. Paletas, raspados,  es una señora muy luchadora. se esfuerza por llevar el sustento a su casa, vende de lunes a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, los días domingo sale a vender ambulante a un campo de beisbol para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en: Martha is a mother of three children who are all living independently.  She has been running her own business for the past 14 years.  She has a small store in her home where she sells a bit of everything, including vegetables, costume jewelry, candies, gum, ice cream, shaved ice, etc.  She is a very hard-working woman. She makes every effort to sustain her household, working from Monday through Sunday from 8am until 5pm.  On Sunday she works as a walking saleswoman at a baseball field in order to obtain more income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business such as costume jewelry, vegetales, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Edinso Manuel

texts.es:
Padre de 2 hijos y con un gran deseo verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales es el motivo que llena de entusiasmo y animo la señor Edinso de 57 años de edad a trabajar incansablemente en su negocio de compra y venta de cerdos y ganado vacuno para obtener su carne y comercializarle pues aspira que con este humilde empleo brindarles una educación universitaria a todos sus hijos.

Ya que su deseo es poder brindarles una buena educación a todos sus hijos y necesita de un empleo capaz de generar los recursos suficientes para cubrir estos gastos sin descuidar los gastos primordiales del hogar. 

Se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos los cuales obtendrá para su posterior venta. 

Edinso está muy motivado con este gran proyecto ya que sus hijos demuestran buenas actitudes estudiantiles y disposición para triunfar y hacer que su padre se sienta más que orgulloso de sus hijos
texts.en:
Edinso is the father of two children with a great desire to see them become professionals. This is the motivation that fills him with enthusiasm. Edinso is 57 years old and works tirelessly in his business selling and buying pigs and cattle in order to obtain their meat and sell it. He hopes to use this humble work to offer his children a university education. 

Since his goal is to offer a good education to his children, he needs a job capable of generating sufficient income in order to cover educational expenses without putting household finances in jeopardy. 

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase hogs which he will subsequently sell.

Edinso is very motivated by his educational and familial project since his children demonstrate good student attitudes and a disposition to triumph and make their father proud.

loans.use: Tp purchase pigs to be raised and resold.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de flores; productos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de El Carmen de Viboral, Antioquia y a algunos distribuidores grandes de flores.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y la compra de semillas de flores, además comprara un plástico grande para cubrir y proteger su cultivo del sol directo.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia
texts.en:
John is a humble and hard working farmer with the drive and determination that distinguishes the men and women of the countryside.

He is a man of an entrepreneurial mind and, since he was young, learned all of the jobs of the farm like growing crops and raising animals so much so that today he has his own crop of flowers, products that he sells in the market plaza of the town of El Carmen de Viboral, Antioquia and to some large flower distributors.

This person has a goal of expanding his crops and improving the ones he currently has. Thus he has looked to the help of a loan to buy agricultural resources like fertilizers and flower seeds as well as buy large plastic to cover and protect his crops from direct sun.

The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as an entrepreneur and as a person, as well as increase his income and keep supporting his family.

The only thing he wants is to be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural items like fertilizers and flower seeds, as well as buy large plastic.

loans.name: Wilton Antonio

texts.es:
Al Sr Wilton Antonio Labora como Vulcanizador en una empresa que reencaucha llantas usadas y nuevas desde hace cinco años iniciando sus lanores todos los dias de 7 am terminando sus labores a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sabado.
El Sr Wilton Antonio necesita el credito para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitacion ya que en la actualidad es tejas de barro y requiere cambiarlo ya que se encuentra deteriorado por eso esta solicitando este prestamo a kyva para solventar esta situacion.
texts.en:
Wilton Antonio has worked as a vulcanizer in a company that retreads new and used tires for the last five years, starting work every day at 7 am and finishing at 5:30 pm, from Monday to Saturday. 

Wilton needs this loan to change the roof of his house. Currently it has a clay tile roof and it needs replacing because it is in a state of disrepair. He is asking for this loan from Kiva in order to resolve this problem.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en: Yahuza is a maize farmer from Kyasge village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahuza can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yahuza said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a maize farmer from Chiroma village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yusuf said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Ruda

texts.en: Ruda is a maize farmer from Gwani village. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Ruda would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ruda can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ruda said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a maize farmer from Bawa Rumi village. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Saratu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel and breeze blocks to build a retaining wall in an area near his home.

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es:
Yorleny
San Ramón 

Yorleny se presenta como una mujer trabajadora, jefa de hogar y madre de un niño de 6 años. Tiene 37 años de edad y 19 años de trabajar en la costura, en empresas y maquilando a particulares. En las temporadas de fin de año ha elaborado ropa propia con la que se ha abierto un mercado y desea invertir para producir ropa deportiva y de mujer principalmente. Ella trabaja desde su casa para estar al tanto de su hijo, y en el transcurso del día trabaja en su producción.

 Su madre le dona las máquinas hace 5 años, desde que nació su hijo; con el objetivo de trabajar desde su casa  para estar al cuidado del pequeño. El  plan de inversión es la compra de materia prima, para producir su propio producto y aprovechar la temporada alta. Se revisan los ingresos y gastos del negocio, demuestra, con el nivel actual, poder cubrir la cuota mensual, proyectando el ingreso adicional espera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio al buscar vender productos elaborados por ella, aumentando así su margen de ganancia.

Ese es su principal sueño, además tener su casa propia e instalar su taller, dándoles trabajo a más mujeres que como ella busca salir adelante, ya que son jefas de hogar.


Cuenta con amplia experiencia en la actividad de textiles, trabajando para maquilas y elaborando su producto, esta segunda actividad se ha visto disminuida debido a la falta de capital. Cuenta con equipo propio que le permite trabajar. Aumentando la cantidad y la calidad de su producción espera mejorar los ingresos y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Yorleny
San Ramón 

Yorleny is a hard working woman, head of the household and mother to a six year old boy. She is 37 years old and has 19 years experience making clothing for companies and individuals. During the end of year season, she has made her own clothing with which she has opened a market and wishes to invest to produce mainly sports and women's clothing. She works from her home so she can be with her son and pass her day working on her production.

Her mother gave her machines five years ago when her son was born with the objective of working from her home so she could care for the little one. The plan for the investment is to buy raw materials to produce her own product and take advantage of the high season. Her income and business expenses have been reviewed demonstrating, at the current level, she can cover her monthly fees, and projects that with the additional income she hopes to improve the conditions of her business selling the products made by her, thus increasing her profit margin.

That is her main dream, as well as to have her own house and to build a workshop, providing jobs to more women like her who are trying to get ahead since they are heads of households.

She has broad experience in the work of textiles, working for a factory and making her own product. She has seen this second job diminish due to the lack of capital. She has her own equipment that allows her to work. By expanding the amount and the quality of her production, she hopes to improve her income and grow her small business.

loans.use: to buy raw material like fabric, thread, elastic, and other items to make clothing.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer from Gwani village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Samaila said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Hannatu

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hannatu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mahammadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mahammadu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Mahammadu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Bamba Yerema Group

texts.fr: Seredalo, membre représentatif est veuve et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. cette brave dame vend de l'eau glacée et des jus qu'elle fait elle-même depuis 9 ans.Avec ses ventes, elle arrive à payer ses factures de courant, à acheter tout ce dont elle a besoin pour le faire les différents jus et faire face à la charge familiale. Cette dame n'est pas resté les bras croisés à se morfondre parce qu'elle est veuve, mais au contraire elle se bat pour l'avenir de ses enfants. Ce prêt lui permettra d’accroître ses ventes, d'acheter de l'eau de bonne qualité pour vendre et aussi de faire des jus. Le bénéfice permettra à Seredalo de continuer ses ventes et de prendre soins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Seredalo is the group representative and a widowed mother to four children, all of whom are currently receiving an education. This brave woman sells chilled water and juice which she has been making herself for the past nine years. With the money she makes from this business she is able to meet all her payments, purchase everything she needs to create the different juices and provide for her family. This woman chose not to dwell on her husband's death, but to fight to give her children a better future. This loan will allow her to increase her sales, purchase good quality water for resale and also for making juices. The profits will allow Seresalo to continue selling her wares and caring for her children.

loans.use: to purchase quality water and make fresh juice which will then be resold

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA BARBARA” iniciará el trigésimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ladrillos y vegetas, venta de dulces y sopas, venta de medias, taller de cerrajería, venta de detergentes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ladrillos y viguetas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de forma independiente al observar a sus hermanas que tienen el mismo negocio, decide independizarse. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de viguetas por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. “SANTA BARBARA” will start its 37th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board where Maria is the President. The businesses run by the members of the community association are varied. Among them are: selling bricks and joists, selling sweets and soups, selling stockings, a locksmith's shop, and selling detergents.

The loan that they will take will benefit the small businesses where Maria is a member. She indicates that five years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of an aunt who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling bricks and joists. She discloses that she learned this business by independent means observing her sisters who also have this type of business. She decided to go out on her own.

The loan that they are now taking is to expand her merchandise (buy joists at wholesale) which she will acquire from the distributors from the city of La Paz. Later, she will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to earn the resources to support her family economically since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy joists at wholesale.

loans.name: Wendpanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOPHIE représente le groupe WENDPANGA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Elle fait la restauration( bière de mil et la soupe) depuis  03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 05 bidons de dolo (bière de mil) pour revendre et 02 cuisses de porc pour sa soupe.
Mme veut réinvestir ses  bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en: Sophie represents the Wendpanga Group. She finds herself in good health. She is a married mother to four children. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest is six. Three of them attend school, and she has two other persons under her care. For the past three years she has been active in the restaurant business. She gets her supplies from a local market. She wants to buy five barrels of dolo (beer made from millet) which she will then resell, as well as two legs of pork for her soup. Sophie wants to reinvest the profits back into her business. She plans on growing her business and seeing to her family's needs.

loans.use: s’acheter 05 bidons de dolo (bière de mil) pour revendre et 02 cuisses de porc pour sa soupe.

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es: Luis es un señor de 35 años de edad, el es casado y tiene una hija de 3 años, el vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo, su esposa es quien ordeña las vacas, Luis se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de ganado y también es integrante de una banda musical, Luis necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca para tenerla juntos a otras vacas que tiene y así incrementar su negocio,  lo que Luis espera es seguir trabajando duro para lograr construir una casa para familia y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en: Luis is a 35 year-old man, is married, and has a three year old daughter. He lives in a rented house, and his wife milks the cows. Luis has made a living for the past 15 years raising cattle, and he is also a member of a musical band. Luis needs a loan to buy a cow to have in addition to his other cows, so that he can grow his business. Luis hopes to continue working hard to be able to build a house for his family and improve his daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Linda Flor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LINDA FLOR” iniciará el décimo primero ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de conservas, venta de polleras, venta de prendas de vestir, venta de cosméticos, confitería, venta de salchipapas, taller mecánico, venta de pasteles y queques.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Francisca es integrante, ella indica que hace once años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de conservas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de forma independiente al acompañar a sus amigas en la compra y venta de estos productos, al adquirir la dinámica y con un pequeño capital decide implementar su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de conservas por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Linda Flor" will begin its eleventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltacion. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Francisca is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied. Among them are: selling preserves, selling skirts, selling dresses, selling cosmetics, confectionary, selling salchipapas (street food), mechanic shop, selling pastries and cakes.

The loan taken will benefit the small businesses where Francisca is a member. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for eleven years, joining at the invitation of an aunt who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling preserves. She indicates that she learned this business in an independent way, accompanying her friends by buying and selling these products. Upon learning the business, and with a small amount of capital, she decided to start her own business.

The loan that she will now take is to expand her merchandise (buy preserves at wholesale) which she will acquire from the vendors from the city of La Paz. Later, she will sell them from her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the advice that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy preserves at wholesale.

loans.name: Erika Alejandra

texts.es:
Erika es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 23 años de edad, comerciante independiente y madre de 1 hijo de 4 años.

Desde hace 1 año comenzó a vender mercancía como ropa en un pequeño almacén con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues desea ampliar su oferta de ropa y mejorar sus ventas, invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor (jeans, camisas, camisetas) además comprara una estantería para exhibir mejor su mercancía brindando mayor comodidad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Erika tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Erika is a dynamic and entrepreneurial 23-year-old young woman. She is an independent businesswoman and mother to a four-year-old son.

One year ago, she started selling merchandise, such as clothes, in a small warehouse in order to make money to contribute to the household finances and to pay for school. 

The loan she is requesting will be of assistance in building up her business, as she wants to expand the range of clothing offered and improve sales.  She will invest the money by purchasing an assortment of wholesale items (jeans, blouses, t-shirts) as well as shelving in order to better display her merchandise, providing greater convenience and better service to her customers, which will make her business more profitable. 

Erika is determined to move forward with her profitable project, because she wants to become a successful businesswoman and ensure a better quality of life and wellbeing for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of wholesale merchandise (shoes, jeans, blouses, shirts, jackets) and shelving in order to store and display the articles of clothing.

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es: Digna es una señora colombiana que vive en Ecuador y que está muy contenta de tener su negocio que es una panadería, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Digna vive con su esposo que es estivador, 2 hijos y 3 nietos, en una casa por la que para arriendo, el negocio es familiar ya que su hijo es quien elabora el pan, las pastas y los demás productos que ofrece, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina, manteca y la demás materia prima que utiliza para hacer el pan, pastas y las decoraciones, lo que Digna espera de su negocio es readecuarlo variar más los  productos que ofrece para aumentar sus ventas y seguir apoyando en la educación de sus nietos.
texts.en: Digna is a Colombian woman who lives in Ecuador and is very happy to have her business, which is a bakery. She is married and has 3 children, and lives with her husband, a wool shearer, two of her sons, and three grandchildren, in a house she rents. Her business is a family business, as her son makes the bread, pastries, and other products offered. The loan will be invested in the purchase of flour, butter, and other raw materials used to make bread, pastries, and frosting. Digna hopes to adjust her business to offer a bigger variety of products, to increase her sales and continue supporting her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, and other raw materials for her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the condition of her business by changing the floor and buying shelf protectors

loans.name: Hugo Dario

texts.es: Dario es un joven trabajador de 21 años de edad, el tiene 2 hijos de 2 meses y de 3 años, Dario se dedica desde hace 4 años a la crianza de ganado, y también trabaja en construcción de casas y en ocasiones  haciendo pan, pues dice que a él le gusta trabajar en lo que pueda para obtener sus ingresos,  el crédito lo va a invertir en la copra de una vaca para dejarla en un terreno donde su abuelita, lo que aspira de su negocio es comprar más vacas para mejorar sus ingresos y de aquí seguir luchando por sus hijos y darles lo necesario y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dario, 21,  is a hardworking young man. He has two children who are two months and three years old.

For four years Dario has been working in cattle breeding. He also works building houses and occasionally in baking, because he says he likes to do whatever work he can to obtain an income.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of a cow, which he will keep on a piece of land where his grandma lives.

His ambition for his business is to buy more cows to increase his income and so be able to go on fighting for his children, give them what they need and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ana Belen

texts.es: Belen vive con su madre y  sus 3 hermanas que están estudiando, a  sus 19 años de edad Belen se dedica un año a la venta de cosméticos por revista y bajo pedidos,  ella se encuentra asistiendo al colegio y sus clientas potenciales son sus compañeras,  el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos, lo que Belen aspira es ofrecer más productos, mejorar sus ventas, por ende mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos diario que tiene de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Belen lives with her mother and her three sisters, who go to school. She is 19 years old and has been working selling cosmetics for 1 year now. She makes catalogue sales and fills orders. She goes to college and her classmates are her potential customers.

She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics. Belen wants to offer more products, improve her sales, and by this to improve her income to pay for her daily expenses for college.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Раъно  41 год.  Она замужем и у нее трое детей. Образование у нее среднее. Эта жизнерадостная трудолюбивая женщина с детства занимается животноводством. Это занятие является   для ее семьи и предков основным  средством  заработка  как и у всех жителей села. В ее семье также занимаются  и земледелием. Подрастающие дети помогают родителям. Вся семья занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока. Семья Раъно хочет увеличить поголовье скота и приобрести  телят для откорма и для этого ей потребуется недостающая сумма за которой она и обратилась по совету друзей в «Арванд»  Она хочет воспользоваться услугами «Арванд» и  улучшить финансовое положение своей семьи и заранее благодарит  за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Rano is 41 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children.  She has the equivalent of a high-school education.  Happy and hardworking, Rano has been raising livestock since her childhood.  As it is the case with all the village residents, animal husbandry has constituted the family's main source of income for many generations. Rano's family is also involved in agriculture and, as the children grow, they get to help their parents.  The whole family is actually involved in fattening livestock and producing milk.  Rano and her family now want to increase their livestock headcount through the purchase of some calves for fattening.  For this reason, and following some friends' advice, Rano is turning to Kiva's partner "MDO Arvand" to receive the amount she still needs for that purchase.  She wants to use the services offered by MDO Arvand and improve her family's financial situation.  She thanks you in advance for your support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Segundo Polivio

texts.es: Polivio es un señor trabajador, está casado y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 19 y 23 años de edad, los tres están estudiando, Polivio  trabaja  dando mantenimiento del agua potable y también criando animales menores, su esposa le apoya en la crianza de los chanchitos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio, para y tener buenas ganancias para de ahí darles la educación  a sus hijos que es lo mas primordial en estos tiempos.
texts.en:
Polivio is a hard-working man who is married with 3 children who are 7, 19 and 23 years old, and are all studying. Polivio works maintaining drinking water, and rearing minor species. His wife helps him to rear the piglets. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs, to improve his business and to have better earnings,which will allow him to give his children an education, which is fundamental nowadays.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa de 25 años de edad, está acompañada, por vivir en una familia de escasos recursos estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica,  su esposo es empleado, brinda seguridad privada en un hotel y con él han procreado dos hijos y ambos estudian. Con ella solo viven su esposo y sus hijos, solo sus hijos dependen de ella.

Rosa se dedica al trabajo de la jarcia, que es el tejido de hamacas, matatas y carteras artesanales, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, sus padres le enseñaron y es así como ella se gana la vida. Rosa hace su trabajo en su casa, no tiene un horario establecido porque lo realiza cada vez que tiene tiempo libre o después que realiza los oficios del hogar.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar material para elaborar hamacas, hilo nylon, hilo de seda, cáñamo y demás. Tiene un mercado potencial en donde le demando mucho el producto que elabora y quiere tener a la mano material para tener siempre mercadería que ofrecer.

Con las ganancias que Rosa obtiene de la venta de sus productos es como mantiene estudiando a sus hijos, por lo que sueña con un negocio más próspero.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25 years old, married, and only studied until third grade because she grew up in a family of scarce resources. Her husband is employed: he provides private security at a hotel. They have two children together, both of whom are in school. She lives with just her husband and their children, and she is only responsible for supporting her children. 

Rosa makes a living making handicrafts out of rope, in which she weaves handmade hammocks, tote bags, and purses. She has been in this line of work for 15 years, which she was taught by her parents. Rosa works from her home, and does not have a set schedule, as she works whenever she has free time or after finishing the household chores. 

The loan will be used to buy material to make hammocks: nylon thread, silk thread, and hemp, among others. She has a potential market where her product is in high demand, and she wants to have the material on hand so that she can always have merchandise to offer. Rosa uses the profits from her sales to support her children's education, which is why she dreams of a more prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase nylon thread, silk thread, and hemp, to make handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Irma Liliana

texts.es: A sus 23 años de edad Liliana es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años mismos que  están estudiando, su esposo trabaja al jornal de trabajo de agricultura, Liliana  necesita el crédito para comprar pollos, comenta que vive arrendando y que hay un pequeño espacio donde puede criar pollos, la aspiración de Liliana es construir un galpón para criar pollos en mayor cantidad y de ahí mejorar su negocio que esto le permite darle lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
At 23 years old, Liliana is married with two children, ages 4 and 6. Her children go to school and her husband works as an agricultural laborer.

Liliana needs the loan to buy chickens. She says that she's renting and there's a little space where she can raise chickens. Liliana's dream is to build a shed to raise more chickens, and from there, to improve her business and give her children everything they need.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Snayder Alan

texts.es: Alan es un joven de 26 años de edad, soltero, comerciante, reside en la Ciudad de Somotillo, Departamento de Chinandega, padre de una pequeña hija, se dedica a la venta de ropa con tres años de experiencia, actualmente  se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para compra de materiales como: zing, perlines, clavos, madera y gastos de mano de obra, para la reparación de su vivienda que esta un poco deteriorada, esto para brindarle a su familia un techo digno y una mejor condición de vida, por lo que agradece a KIVA y a Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Alan is 26 years old. He is a single businessman and he lives in the city of Somotillo, in the department of Chinandega. He is the father of a young daughter. He makes a living selling clothes, in which he has three years of experience. Currently, he is asking for a loan from Ceprodel in order to pay for  materials (such as zinc, purlins, nails, and wood) and labor costs for the repair of his house, which is a little run-down. This way, he can provide a decent place to live for his family and better living conditions. For this, he would like to thank KIVA and Ceprodel for their support.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, nails, purlins, etc.

loans.name: Momo

texts.fr: Momo est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants ; âgée de 44 ans, elle habite le quartier Baguida et vend du maїs, du riz et de l’huile depuis 1999, donc s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché de la localité. Elle est en location, se nourrit deux fois par jours ; elle a un niveau d’étude secondaire, mais se soigne en cas de maladie par automédication et aussi ne dispose d’aucun moyen de transport. Alors, la nommée Momo désire  solliciter un microcrédit pour agrandir son activité génératrice de revenu afin d’aider son marie dans les charges liés à leur foyer et aussi subvenir aux besoins de la famille, même s’approprier d’un lopin de terre pour leur propre construction.
texts.en: Momo is a 44-year-old married mother to two children. She lives in Baguida district and has been selling maize, rice and oil since 1999. She gets her supplies four times every month from the local market. She currently rents her property and eats twice daily. She has attained a secondary level of education, but she sees to her own healthcare and also has no means of transportation at her disposal. Momo wants to request a microloan to grow her revenue-generating activity so that she can assist her husband with their household expenses and also their family's needs, including purchasing a plot of land so they can build their own home.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of rice, 10 litres of oil and one sack of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the modules and processing of her degree

loans.name: Luz Andina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ ANDINA” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de chompas, venta de tenis, venta de frutas, venta de pañales, venta de perfumes y cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paola es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de forma independiente al observar la necesidad de este servicio en su zona. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de papa y platos por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Luz Andina' is about to begin its eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional hub. 'Luz Andina' is made up of 9 members and Sra. Paola is the president of the board of directors. The members of this communal bank are forging ahead with a number of diverse businesses. These include a local shop, and the sale of jumpers, trainers, fruit, baby's clothes, perfumes and cosmetics. 

The loan that they are asking for will benefit small businesswomen like Sra. Paola. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution. Nowadays she has a business that sells food. She tells us that she began this business after noticing a need for it in her area. 

The loan will be used to increase her stock. She will buy potatoes and plates in bulk, and she plans to buy these in the markets of La Paz. After she has prepared the food, she will sell it in her shop space. This type of work allows her to support her family economically, since she is single. 

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said that she liked the consultation services that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy potatoes and plates in bulk.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan de 25 años de edad es soltero y habita en vivienda propia desde hace 23 años acompañados de su madre y hermanos. Él es el mayor de los hermanos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de ser el mayor apoyo para su madre tanto moral como económica, y es por ello que presta sus servicios de mantenimiento en una empresa cercana. Juan es un joven agradecido que desea construir un servicio sanitario lavable en su vivienda, ya que el actual se encuentra bastante deteriorado y el tiene el temor que en cualquier momento sea un foco de infecciones, por ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: una taza lavable, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un servicio sanitario lavable en su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan, 25 years old, is single and has lived in his own house for the past 23 years with his mother and siblings. He is the oldest of the siblings, so he has decided to be the greatest support for his mother, morally and economically, and for this he works as a maintenance worker at a nearby business. Juan is a grateful young man who wants to build a washable bathroom in his home, since the current one is rather deteriorated and he fears that at any moment it could be a source of infections, so he asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase a sink, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a washable bathroom in his home.

loans.use: to purchase a sink, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a washable bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 55 años de edad, casado, y su negocio es la venta de materiales de construcción.
Él es fuerte, constante, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Pampahasi’ sitio caracterizado por encontrarse sobre una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas
Juan es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura alta, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que también trabaja en el mismo negocio, ambos viven en una casa propia que tiene el servicio de luz. Su negocio es la venta de arena por cubos; él se encarga de ir hasta el río en su camión y con la ayuda de su esposa se encargan de cernir y cargar la arena solamente con una pala. Es una labor bastante pesada que ya lleva realizando por más de quince años y esta es la quinta secuencia de préstamos en la institución. Su negocio prospera porque la arena se ha convertido en el segundo recurso natural más demandado, por detrás del agua, La arena se ha hecho imprescindible en la actividad industrial y la construcción. Su sueño es comprar otra volqueta porque la que tiene esta dañada y todo el tiempo debe repararla perdiendo tiempo y dinero. Él desea realizar la reparación de la caja de cambios de su principal herramienta; su camión.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para arreglar su principal herramienta de trabajo, su camión arenero.
texts.en:
Juan is a 55 year old man. He is married and his business is selling construction materials. He is strong, dependable, independent, responsible, and hard working. He performs his work in the Pampahasi area, a place characterized for being on the side of the city where the streets are steep.

Juan is dark complected, has short black hair, is tall, and his mother tongue is Aymara and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his wife who also works in the same business. Both live in their own house that has light service. His business is selling sand by the bucket. He is in charge of going to the river in his truck and, with the help of his wife, they are responsible for sifting and loading the sand with a shovel only. It is quite hard work which he has been doing for more than 15 years already and this is the fifth loan cycle with the institution. His business prospers because the sand has become the second most in demand resource, after water. The sand has become essential for industrial and construction activities. His dream is to buy another dump truck because the one he has is damaged and he has to repair it all the time, thus losing time and money. He wishes to make repairs to the gearbox of his main tool: his truck.

For these reasons, Juan is requesting a loan to fix his main work tool, his sand truck.

loans.use: to fix his main working tool: his sand truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized steel sheets, poles and beams to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is thirty-five years old. She is a female with three children and is living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a food stall but also has a cocoa garden that supplements her business. She uses proceeds from her business to look after her children and is very hard-working.

She hopes to expand her business though she is affected by inadequate capital and seasonality.

She wants the loan to buy more food stuff to sell.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi âgée de 54 ans est née à Lomé la capitale du Togo. Marié et mère de 6 enfants, Afi est revendeuse de bouillie, pain et beignets ; et habite le quartier Baguida. Afi a commencé son activité en 1974 et s’approvisionne en maïs  1 fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour augmenter son commerce, Afi sollicite un crédit lui permettant de s’approvisionner en sac de maïs et en sucre. Afi est analphabète mais est bien douée en gestion et pense assurer l’éducation de ses enfants avec les revenus de son activité.
texts.en: 54-year-old Afi was born in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is a married mother to six children. Afi sells porridge, bread and fritters. She lives in Baguida district. Afi started her business in 1974 and gets her supply of maize once per month from the main market in Lomé. In order to grow her business, Afi is requesting a loan which will allow her to purchase one sack of maize and one sack of sugar. Afi is illiterate but she is very skilled in managing her affairs and she wants to use the profits from her business to ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of maize and one sack of sugar

loans.name: Maria Nieves

texts.es: Maria tiene 49 años de edad, es una señora divorciada, tiene  5 hijos pero de ellos  solo 2 viven con ella y están estudiando a distancia y los demás ya son independientes, Maria se dedica  desde hace 8 años a la crianza de pollos, ella también trabaja de empleada domestica en una casa, el crédito lo necesita para comprar pollos y tenerlos  en un pequeño galpón, la aspiración de Maria es de apoyar a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios y tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Maria, 49, is divorced with five children. Only two live with her and they are enrolled in distance learning. The rest are already independent.

For eight years Maria has been working in chicken breeding. She also works as a maid in a house.

She needs the loan to be able to buy chickens and keep them in a small shed.

Her ambition is to help her children to finish their studies and have a good future.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey runs a bar in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged forty-seven. He is married and has three children who all attend school. 

He desires to develop and expand his business however competition and inadequate capital hinder the achievement of his desired dream. He will use the loan facility to buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is thirty-four years old, married and has four children, two of whom attend school. 

She operates a bar mainly selling beers and sodas and she earns additional income from farming. 

She desires to develop and expand her business in order to improve her standards of living. She will use the loan facility to buy more beer to sell this Christmas season before prices shoot up high.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Dulces Corazones Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DULCES CORAZONES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ladrillos y vegetas, venta de dulces y sopas, venta de medias, taller de cerrajería, venta de detergentes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de chompas a máquina; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en su colegio, donde le enseñaron la técnica de tejido, posteriormente decidió emprender este conocimiento como un  negocio independientemente para ayudar a su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de lana por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus amigas y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta ausente una cliente la misma no quiso salir en la imagen por razones religiosas.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Dulces Corazones" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Miriam is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied.
