Among them are, selling bricks and joists, selling sweets and soups, selling stockings, a locksmith shop, selling detergents.

The loan that they will take is to benefit the small businesses where Miriam is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a weaving business and sells machine-made sweaters. She indicates that she learned this business in high school where they taught weaving techniques. Later, she decided to use this knowledge with an independent business to help her family.

The loan that she will now take is to expand her merchandise (buy wool at wholesale) which she will acquire from vendors in the city of La Paz. Later, once her products are made, she will sell them from her sales space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she lives with her partners and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes to share with her friends and likes the training that the institution offers.

In the image, one of the clients is absent since she did not want to be in the image for religious reasons.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 44-year-old married male with six children. He lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He is a hardworking man and intends to use his loan to repair his tractor.

Micheal has got a tractor that he hires for plowing. He started this business to enable him to sustain his family. He has a great dream of educating all his children, however competition affects his business.

loans.use: to repair his tractor

loans.name: Jesus Gerardo

texts.en: Jesus is 28 years old, lives in a free union and is the father of two children. He lives at home with relatives. For ten years, Jesus has dedicated himself to training in business. Three years ago he decided to open a fruit stand. He also has another job with another relative who own a juice and soda stand. Jesus is a man dedicated to his family and is always searching for new opportunities to generate  income to provide for their necessities. Jesus is using this loan to buy seasonal fruit and is trying to reduce costs of transportation.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla âgée de 32 ans est née à kouvé, localité située à 65 kilomètre de Lomé et est de nationalité togolaise. Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, Abla est revendeuse de pagne et habite le quartier Baguida. Elle a commencé son activité en 2009 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé 4 fois par mois. Pour renforcer son activité, Abla sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 1 sac de maïs, du riz et d’huile pour ajouter a la vente de pagne afin de faire plus de bénéfice.
texts.en: 32-year-old Abla was born in Kouvé, situated 65 kilometers from Lomé. She is a Togo national. She is a married mother to four children. Alba sells traditional pagne cloth and lives in Baguida district. She started her business in 2009 and gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé four times per month. Abla is requesting a loan to purchase one sack of maize, one sack of rice and oil, which will be resold alongside her pagne cloth in order to make a larger profit.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of maize and one sack of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: PVC pipes, cement and sand to make a connection of rainwater into her home.

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: José de 50 años de edad es soltero y habita junto a su madre de 68 años de edad y hermanos desde hace 50 años. Él es un hombre que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, sus problemas físicos no han sido un impedimento para que este hombre emprendedor siga adelante ya que después de su accidente hace 14 años tomo la decisión e instalo una venta de zapatos femeninos en su cantón, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sostenerse y apoyar a su madre con los gastos económicos de su vivienda. José ha tomado la firme decisión de construir un muro perimetral ya que su vivienda se encuentra desprotegida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, bloques de cemento y hierro para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda lo antes posible y así darle una mayor seguridad a su vivienda. Agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para mejorar las condiciones de la cocina.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old, single and has lived his entire life together with his 68 year old mother and his siblings. He is a man who always looks for ways to get ahead in life. His physical problems have not been an impediment to him. 

This enterprising man continues to make progress since taking the decision, after an accident 14 years ago, to set up a shop selling women's shoes in his neighbourhood. Thanks to this business he has been able to support himself and help his mother with the household expenses. 

José has taken the firm decision to build a perimeter wall, as his home is currently unprotected. For this reason he is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cement, sand, gravel, concrete blocks and iron to construct the wall as soon as possible and provide better security for his home. He is grateful for the support he received in the past to improve his kitchen.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, concrete blocks and iron in order to build a perimeter wall around his home.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre. 
En este lugar vive don Diego, tiene 30 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposa trabaja en un centro comercial de la localidad.
El señor Digo es guardia de seguridad  en una institución del gobierno y también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y sabanas, deja a crédito y les cobra cada 8 días, lleva mas de 2 años con este negocio con el cual se gana algo extra que le sirve para  sacar adelante a su familia.
Esta repitiendo el crédito, siempre utiliza los créditos para comprar más mercadería, las ganancias  las utiliza para comprar lo necesario para su familia y darles lo mejor a sus hijos. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa y sabanas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 6 ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the 26 de Septiembre street area in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita, which is known as the City of the Real Tamarindos, the members of the credit group 24 de Septiembre meet every 15 days. This is where 30-year-old Diego lives. He is married and has two children from this marriage, ages 11 and 6. His children go to school and his wife works at a shopping center in the area. Diego is a security guard in a government institution and he also works selling all kinds of clothing and sheets. He lets people buy them on credit and charges them every eight days. He's been doing this for over two years and it allows him to earn a little something extra which helps his family get ahead. 

He's asking for another loan, as he always uses the loans to buy more merchandise. He uses his earnings to buy the necessities for his family and to give his children all the best. He's going to use this loan to buy clothing and sheets. He's been in the credit group for six cycles and he likes it because they help him get the loans. His dream is to give his family all the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sheets.

loans.name: Safira

texts.en:
Safira is 55 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Safira works very hard to provide for them.

Safira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items.

Safira has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future Safira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items

loans.name: Alisi

texts.en:
Alisi is a 25-year-old single woman with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her business is cocoa buying and selling, but she also sells rice. She is very hardworking, and looks after her home alone.

She started the business five years ago, and is hopeful that her business will grow bigger in the near future.

She wants the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa

loans.name: María Patricia

texts.en:
Maria Patricia is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

Maria is 49 years old, is married, and is the mother of three: two girls and a boy. She has been a merchant for 10 years now, and makes a living by attending her convenience store.

In her store she sells all sorts of grocery products such as dairy products, sausages, bread, and fruit. She asks for this loan to stock up her business by buying wholesale; this way she is able to take advantage of discounts offered by her suppliers and increase her income.

Thanks to the effort Maria puts into her work she was able to recently acquire  the premises where her store is, which she used to rent.

loans.use: to stock up her business by buying wholesale and taking advantage of discounts

loans.name: Mario Oduber

texts.es: Mario de 48 años de edad es un hombre que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos un varón de 12 años de edad y 2 niñas de 16 y 14 años de edad. Él es un hombre responsable que se apoya con su compañera de vida  para mantener el equilibrio económico en su hogar. Mario es feliz con su familia pero sabe que sus condiciones de vida no son las mejores, es por ello que se esfuerza en su trabajo de albañil independiente, además su compañera de vida le brinda mucho apoyo con su negocio de venta de tortillas. Mario desea dar mayor seguridad a su familia por lo que ha decidido construir un muro perimetral, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mario, 48, is a man who always looks for ways to help his 3 children (a boy of 12 and two girls of 16 and 14) to get ahead in life. He is a responsible man who, along with his life partner, works to maintain the economic equilibrium in his home. 

Mario is happy with his family but he knows that their living conditions are not the best. For this reason he puts a lot of effort into his work as a self-employed bricklayer. His life partner also makes a big contribution with her business selling tortillas. 

Mario wishes to provide better security for his family and so he has decided to build a perimeter wall. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron in order to build this wall around his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron in order to build a perimeter wall around his home.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Doña Johana mantiene siempre su negocio de pulpería gracias al apoyo de  crédito, medio por el que ha salido adelante con su familia. Johana requiere del apoyo de crédito para mantener los productos dentro del negocio y continuar con las ventas que le permitan mantener los estudios de sus hijos como la universidad y escuela secundaria, con el crédito podrá comprar los productos como granos básicos, carnes, cereales, gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en: Johana always maintains her grocery business thanks to the support of loans, a means through which she has gotten her family ahead. Johana needs loan support to keep the products in her business and continue with sales that allow her to provide her children's education at university and secondary school. With the loan, she will be able to buy products like basic grains, meats, cereals, sodas, among others.

loans.use: to invest in the business and continue with sales that allow her to maintain the education of her children at university and secondary school.

loans.name: Mariela Rocio

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 5  y 3  años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio, los siguientes en escuela e inicial. El marido es maestro.
Doña Mariela en su casa vende helados de una marca muy reconocida, agua en bidón y productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días ya que además de salir a recorrer también vende en su casa, ella deja a crédito los productos Avon y cobra semanalmente, lleva dos años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia. 
Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como siempre financia su negocio, para ella los créditos le son de mucha ayuda y su negocio siempre le da buenas ganancias que le sirven para darles lo mejor a sus hijos. Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, helados y agua en bidón. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años  y le gusta por la atención medica y medicinas gratuitas. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the Grupo de Crédito 24 de septiembre meet in Portoviejo city, in the sector called  26th of September, which is an area known as Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos. Mariela, 29. lives here in a civil partnership from which she has three children aged 12, 5 and 3. The eldest studies in high school and the others are in primary and pre-school. Her husband is a teacher.

Dona Mariela has a business in her house where she sells a well-known brand of ice cream, water in large drums, and Avon products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women). She works every day, and in addition to selling from her house, goes out weekly  to collect payments for the Avon products she has left on credit. She has been working in this business for 2 years and, through it, earns a living to help support her family.

She is requesting another loan since this is how she has always financed her business. The loans are of great help to her, and her business always provides her with good earnings which help her to give her children the best.  She has been in the Grupo De Crédito for 3 years and she likes it for the free medical help and medicines it provides.

Her dream is it see her children complete their studies and be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, ice creams, and large drums of water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fertilize his cacao crop

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 35 years old, and married with two children; both of them are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc..

Imelda has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Sherlita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Sherlita is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Sherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a married woman with seven children. She is 53 years old, and has one child who is in school.

Alejandra has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alejandra requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gallons of coconut wine to sell.

She has been in this business for one year. In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Norelyn

texts.en:
Norelyn is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Norelyn has previously borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Erose

texts.en:
Erose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell peanuts business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional peanuts to sell for her buy-and-sell peanuts business.

Erose has been in this business for 7 years. Erose earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Erose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional peanuts to sell for her business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela works hard to support six children. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Estela requested a PHP 6,350 loan through NWTF to buy solar lamps.

She is getting the solar lamps because she wants to have a good lightsource that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Estela is aware that by using the solar lamps, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks for her family.

loans.use: to buy solar lamps

loans.name: Irrene

texts.en:
Irrene is a 50-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is very hardworking and committed to her business of selling food stuffs and this has helped her to afford the basic needs of life. She also buys and sells cocoa and has a cocoa garden. She hopes to expand her business to serve her customers better. Seasonality is her major challenge.

She wants a loan to buy cocoa for resale since the season is now favorable.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria es una señora casada que tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 están estudiando, ella trabaja de empleada domestica y también se dedica a la elaboración de pan para entregarlo  a las tiendas, escuelas y colegios, su esposo le ayuda en este negocio,  Gloria necesita el crédito para comprar harina y los demás implementos que se utiliza para sus productos, su aspiración es mejorar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos para de ahí darles a sus hijos lo necesario para que estudien.
texts.en: Gloria is a married woman who has 6 children. 4 of her children are at school. She works as a household help, and also she makes bread to deliver it to shops, schools, and colleges. Her husband helps her with this business. Gloria needs a loan to buy flour and other supplies which she needs for her products. Her hope is to improve her sales and, by this, to improve her income in order to give her children everything they need to go to school.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Cruz Omaira

texts.es: Omaira es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 6 años de edad que se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela, Omaira se dedica a la venta de ropa por  catalogo, bajo pedido y ofreciendo puerta a puerta  a sus clientes y amigos, también trabaja en una cabina telefónica, el crédito lo necesita para invertir en la compra de ropa, la aspiración de Omaira es trabajar duro y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija y sobre todo que  su hija siga normalmente sus estudios.
texts.en:
Omaira is a single mother. She has a 6-year-old daughter who goes to school. Omaira works selling clothes by catalogue, on order and from door to door to her customers and friends. She also works at a phone booth.

She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of clothing. Omaira's plan is to work very hard and to improve the quality of life of her daughter, and, above all, to let her daughter continue with her studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: José Ignacio

texts.en:
Jose Ignacio is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story:

Jose is 19 years old and is single, living in his parents' house. He has been a merchant for six years now; he started doing business by helping his parents in a taco and hamburger stand; there he was paid, was able to save some money and open up his own business. 

He has owned a fruit and vegetable stand for three years now.  It is located inside a crowded market, and has frequent customers. 

He asks for this loan to stock up his business with seasonal fruit; this way he will be able to increase his sales and his income.

Thanks to the effort Jose puts into his work, he has been able to start helping with the family expenditures, which allows his parents to spend their money on their own purposes.

loans.use: to stock up his fruit selling business with seasonal products

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 66 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad.
Doña Rosa con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de bisuterías, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor de las veces ella vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días ya que sale y vende en su casa, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar bisuterías en varios modelos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños tener buena salud y salir adelante
texts.en:
In the 26 de Septiembre street area in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita, which is known as the City of the Real Tamarindos, the members of the credit group 24 de Septiembre meet every 15 days. This is where Rosa lives. She is 66 years old, separated and has five older children from this relationship. Rosa intends to earn something on her own and to move foward. She sells costume jewelry from her home. She sells them door to door, although most of the time her customers come to her house to buy them. She works every day as she sells from home. She allows her customers to pay on credit and she charges them every 8 or 15 days. She's been doing this for over five years.

She's going to use this loan to buy various kinds of costume jewelry. She's been with her credit group from the beginning and she likes it because she uses the loans to finance her business. Her dreams are to have good health and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to keep up and fertilize her cacao field.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  Victoria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, gasoline, etc for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Marialyn has been in this business for 8 years. Marialyn earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina is 62 years old and married with 11 children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Quirina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Quirina has been pig fattening for three years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 37 years old, and married with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maricel has a root crop farming business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has been in this business for three years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 24,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Gemalyn has been in this business for 20 years. Gemalyn earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gemalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Aileu and she is a business woman. She has been doing business since 2012 with her own working capital of $600. 

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital in order to buy more supplies to keep such as sugar, salt, soaps, biscuits, water, candles, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks and other things to sell. 

She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management of her business and to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soaps, biscuits, water, candles, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Joana Elizabeth

texts.es: Joana es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 11 años de edad que asisten a la escuela, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también trabaja de empleada domestica, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para mejorar su negocio y  aspirar seguir comprando mas pollos criándolos y así mejorar sus ingresos para el  bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Joana is a single mother, she has two children, who are 9 and 11 years old and go to school. She works raising small animals, and she also works as a domestic help.

She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of chickens, in order to improve her business, and she hopes to buy more chickens, to raise them and by this to improve her income for the wellbeing of her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên  is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

Liên has a retail business selling clothes, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Liên faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet, a bathroom and a water filter system. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom and water filter system

loans.name: Guadalupanas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GUADALUPANAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapas, carnicería, venta de galletas y goyurd, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de ropa, licorería, venta de chamarras, venta de sopa de fideo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar que en su zona o existía este negocio y que era solicitado por ella y por sus vecinos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The C.A. “GUADALUPANAS” will start its second loan cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Regional Hub of Los Andes. It is comprised by nine members and directed by a board of directors where Adela is President. The businesses of the members are diverse, such as: sale of salchipapas (sausages and potatoes), butcher shop, sale of cookies and yogurts, sale of quinoa juice, sale of clothing, alcohol store, sale of jackets, sale of noodle soup. The loan will benefit the group of businesswomen, where Adela is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago because she was invited by a member of the institution who went to visit her at her home. Currently, she has a neighborhood grocery store. She says that she started this business after seeing that in her neighborhood there were no shops and that there was demand from her and her neighbors. The loan will be to increase her capital (to get grocery store items at wholesale prices), which she will get from the wholesale saleswomen in the city of La Paz, and that later she will sell in her sales space. This job will allow her to generate resources to support her family financially, because she is married and has two children. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy grocery items at wholesale prices.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, Tiene 31 años de edad y está casada, fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 7, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería, cosméticos y accesorios) trabaja todos los días, más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela y se le hace más fácil salir a  vender, ella entrega todos sus productos a crédito y  cobra cada quince días, lleva 5 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 4 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area of 26 de Septiembre street in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita, which is known as the City of the Real Tamarindos, the members of the credit group 24 de Septiembre meet every 15 days. This is where María lives. She is 31 years old, married and has two children, ages 9 and 7, from this marriage. Both of her children go to school and her husband is a construction worker. She's a very good housewife and to help her husband with the household expenses, she sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume, cosmetics and accessories). She works every day, more so in the mornings as her children are in school which makes it easier to go out and sell. She allows her customers to buy all of her products on credit and she charges them every 15 days. She's done this for five years and with this she has been able to earn a little for her family. 

She'll use this loan to buy lotion, perfume, costume jewelry and cosmetics. She's been in the credit group for four cycles and she likes it because of the benefits and help that the institution gives her. Her dream is to give her children all the best.

loans.use: to buy lotion, perfume, costume jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nhóm 02-Phố Lai Thành-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh is 37 years old, and she is married, with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Hạnh has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2013, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hạnh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02-Phố Lai Thành-Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food (rice, processed mushrooms, salt, cake) to sell.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.


Trong gia đình chị có 02 người sống phụ thuộc.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food (rice, processed mushrooms, salt, cake)

loans.name: Paula Cleotilde

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Paula,  tiene 66 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esa relación tiene 3 hijas mayores de edad, dos  de ellas aun viven en su casa a pesar de que están casadas.
Doña Paula es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo e interiores, siempre vende productos o mercadería que este de temporada ya que estas se venden más rápido, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa interior. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal María Monserrate (Maria Monserrate Communal Bank) meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are recognized nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama hat. 

This is where 66-year-old Paula lives. Her husband passed away several years ago and left her a widow. She has 3 grown daughters from this relationship, two of whom still live with her even though they are married. Paula is a very tenacious woman who likes to do things for herself to get ahead. She works selling all types of clothing, including underwear.  She is always searching for what is in season because that is what sells most rapidly. She sells door-to-door but she also sells from her house where her customers go when they need to buy some clothing. 

She extends credit to her customers and collects on a weekly basis. She has been engaged in this occupation for more than 5 years and it has allowed her to earn a living. This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she is pleased because she started up her business with one of the loans. Her dream is to have a fixed location for selling her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Felicitas Rosa

texts.es:
Felicitas es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir, tiene dos maravillosos hijos por los que siempre lo ha dado todo para poder sacarlos adelante, desde hace muchísimos años se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como cerdos, cuyes, ovejas, entre otros, ella se esfuerza mucho para poder criarlos de manera saludable y ofertarlos a los diversos clientes, con estos ingresos es que está educando a sus hijos por lo cual trabaja muy duro.
Felicitas está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mayor cantidad de animales para crianza. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, con esto sus ingresos mejorarán porque tendrá más animales para ofrecer. Más adelante espera poder terminar de construir su casa para que sus seres queridos vivan de manera segura y cómoda.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a hard-working woman with a lot of desire to get ahead. She has two marvelous children for whom she has always done everything she can to get them ahead. Many years ago she started to work raising and selling animals like pigs, guinea pigs, sheep, amongst others. She makes a big effort to raise them in a healthy manner and offer them to her different clients. She is educating her children with the income so she is working very hard.

Felicitas is grateful to the Kiva lenders as with the loan they have given her as she can buy a greater quantity of animals to raise. She is also grateful as with the loan her revenues will increase since she will have more animals to sell. Later on she hopes to complete the construction of her house so that her loved ones can live in a safe and comfortable manner.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, sheep and pigs for her business.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu, 44, is a married woman with nine children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marichu has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Marichu has been in this business for 20 years. 

Marichu requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of used clothes to sell.

In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 60 years old, married and has seven children.  

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Trinidad has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alicia has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 64 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. Monica runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Monica has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. In the future, Monica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mirlande

texts.en:
Mirelande is the owner of Guapissima. She bought it from Annette Gordon, the founder of Guapissima. She studied professional cooking and also managed a kindergarten. She is married and responsible. She is an inspired woman who diversifies Guapissima’s production by making cakes, jams, cremas, etc. Thanks to her experience, Guapissima became a well-known business in Mirebalais through its involvement in education and food service. 

The purpose of this loan is to answer customer demands and increase income. This will allow the business to purchase materials (cake, jam, peanut butter) and equipment to increase its production capacity in order to offer better service and create more jobs.

loans.use: to purchase materials (cake, jam, peanut butter)  and equipment to increase its production capacity.

loans.name: Cerez

texts.en:
Cerez is 47 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by buying and selling pigs in the Philippines. Cerez is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell.

She has been buying and selling pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
Jennilyn is 47 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jennilyn has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennilyn has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Jennilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucia Maribel

texts.es: Lucia es una señora casada, tiene 3 hijos de 3, 6 y 11 años de edad, de ellos los mayores asisten a la escuela, su esposo trabaja de albañil, Lucia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, y también a la comercialización de estos,  el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para venderlos en las ferias de las ciudades más cercanas, lo que va  Lucia aspira de este negocio es ampliarlo  y mejorar las ventas y por ende aumentar  sus ingresos, todo lo hace para darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman. She has three children, who are 3, 6, and 11 years old. The older children go to school. Her husband works as a bricklayer.

Lucia works raising small animals, and she also sells them. She will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs, in order to sell them at the markets of the towns nearby. Lucia hopes that her business will increase, and that her sales will improve, so that she can increase her income. She does all this to offer her children a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Tuvshinjargal, 43 years old, lives with his brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working at a mining company since 2012. During his day off, he renders taxi service to local people. His brother studies at university. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay his brother's tuition fee, so that his brother will study hard without worrying about the tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 27 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.
Dung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for five years.

In 2013, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Dung faces in her life is not having a Biogas System. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for a Biogas System installation.

In the future, Dung hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a Biogas System installation.

loans.name: Yanapasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YANAPASIÑANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Milka es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas y enaguas, venta de manzanas, venta de chompas, venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de mandiles, venta de DVD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Milka es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de  su madre que tiene el mismo negocio, posteriormente decidió emprender su negocio independientemente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de refrigerador) que lo adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The C.A. “YANAPASIÑANI” will start its first loan cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Regional Hub of Villa Exaltación. It is comprised by eight members and directed by a board of directors, where Milka is Secretary. The businesses carried out by the members of the communal association are diverse. Among them are: sale of sweaters and underskirts, sale of apples, sale of sweaters, sale of food, sale of blankets, sale of aprons, sale of DVDs. The loan they will get will benefit small businesswomen, where Milka is a member. She says that it is the first time she belongs to Pro Mujer. She joined after being invited by a girlfriend who is member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. She says that she learned this business from her mother who has the same business. Later on, she decided to open her own business independently. The loan she will get will be to increase her merchandise (to buy a refrigerator), which she will purchase from the distributors in the city of La Paz, and later will install in her sales space. This way of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family financially, because she is single and has a son. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Remilda

texts.en:
Remilda is 44 years old, married, and a resident of Misom, Baliangao, Philippines. Her husband is a manual laborer. They have three children; all are in school.  Starting with capitalization of 2,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2013, and has taken out two loans. 

Now she is applying for 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, specifically basic commodities.  

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: Purchase stocks for the sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive La señora Rosa, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad, ambos estudian en universidad y colegio, ella vive en la casa de los padres.
Doña Rosa con la intención de lograr sus propios recursos y con estos sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica al comercio, ella junto  a su hermana tienen un negocio de  compra y venta de pescado, cuatro veces por semana se van hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a distribuir el pescado a comerciantes minoristas en esa ciudad, ellas compran el pescado  en las playas de Manta lugar en el cual les dejan a  muy buen precio, llevan en este negocio  más de 20 años con el cual salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar pescado. Está en el Grupo De Crédito casi desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido sacar adelante  a sus hijos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are recognized at a national and international level. It is the land of the famous Panama hat.

Rosa, 52, lives here. She is a single mother of two children, 16 and 19, who are high school and university students. She lives in her parents house.
  
In order to have her own resources and thus help her children to better themselves, she and her sister have a business buying and selling fish. Four times a week they go to the beaches in Manta, where they can buy fish at the best prices, and then they sell it to retailers in the city of Guayaquil. They have had this business for more than 20 years and it has helped them to get on in life.

She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of fish. She has been in the credit group almost since it first started, and she likes it because with the loans she has been able to help her children to get on in life.

Her dream is to continue to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Mariana Maribel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 20, 16 y 10  años de edad, estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su marido es trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
Doña Mariana trabaja de maestra en una  escuela en la zona y también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, su forma de  venta es  puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres y fines de semana,  también les vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia en su lugar de trabajo cuando está desocupada, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatos. Lleva tres ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate credit group meets every 15 days in the Montecristi area. This region is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are nationally and internationally recognized. This is where the famous Panama hats come from. This is where 46-year-old Mariana lives. She is married and has three children from this marriage, ages 20, 16 and 10. They go to university, high school and elementary school. Her husband works in a factory in Manta. Mariana is a school teacher in the area and also works selling all kinds of clothing and shoes. She goes door to door selling in her free time and on the weekends. She also sells to her collegues and mothers where she works when she's not busy. She allows her customers to buy on credit and she charges them every eight days. She's been doing this for over three years, with which she earns a little extra to get ahead. 

She's going to use this credit to buy pants, blouses, tshirts and shoes. She's been in the credit group for three cycles and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, tshirts and shoes.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.en:
Maruja is 35 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Maruja is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maruja has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maruja requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Maruja would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Helen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 39 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Maribeth works very hard to provide for them.

Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Maribeth would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Alicia has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Louella

texts.en:
Louella is 40 years old, and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Louella has been in this business for four years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a banana vending business in the Philippines. Nory has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of bananas to sell for her banana vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 29 years old and married with four children who are attending school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending. Marilyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Benedicta is 54 years old and one of her children is in school. Benedicta has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Benedicta has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Việt

texts.en:
Việt is 47 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Việt is a farmer. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygeinic latrine.
 
This is Việt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Việt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nancy Marisol

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy,  tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijas de 17, 15, 10 y 6  años de edad, las dos mayores estudian en colegio y las menores en escuela. Su marido es chofer.
Doña Nancy con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto poder solventar sus gastos y los del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, interiores, zapatillas y varios otros productos de catálogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres a cuatros  días a la semana en sus recorridos, aprovecha  las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos porque es más fresco y porque sus hijos más pequeños están en la escuela, ella lleva 8 años en este negocio el cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del Grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, zapatillas, perfumes, entre otras cosas que vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 8 años y le gusta porque con el crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "María Monserrate" communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Montecristi known in the country and internationally for it's rich pre-colonial culture and for it's crafts. It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Nancy who is 38 years old lives in this place. She is married and from this relationship has four children aged 17, 15, 10 ans 6 years old. The two oldest study in Secondary school and the others study in Primary school. Her husband is a driver.

With the goal of having her own income and with it be able to pay the household expenses works selling clothing of all types, underwear, shoes and various other products from catalogs. Her form of selling is from door-to-door. She works 3 to 4 days in the week doing her rounds taking advantage of the morning hours when it is cooler and her younger children are in school.

She has been in this business for 8 years. She started it with the first loan that she received from the Group and she is grateful for that. She will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes amongst other things that she sells. She has been a member of the communal bank for 8 years and she likes it since she started her business with a loan. Her dreams are to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Avarica

texts.en:
Avarica is 29 years old from Dulag, Leyte. She is married with three children aged 4 to 9. She has been engaged in selling frozen meat products like tocino, sausage and hot dogs for seven years now. She and her husband also farm coconut for additional income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy frozen and processed meat products and fertilizer for farming. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her business, so she can support the needs of her children in terms of food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy frozen and processed meat products and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 04 hijos dependientes, vive con su cónyugue y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en el negocio. Cristian vive en el caserío de Yerma distrito de Cañarís, el cual es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, el cual se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Cañarís, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. En dicho caserío sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, caserío mediano.

Cristian se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte cuenta con una unidad móvil(mototaxi) de su propiedad, con la cual realiza dicho servicio, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, su servicio lo brinda en su comunidad y en los alrededores; por su buen servicio cuenta con bastante clientela, además se dedica a la cría de animales como ganado vacuno y caprino, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio pues desea realizar el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil, para poder asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo y así poder seguir generando sus ingresos propios.
texts.en:
Cristian is 45 years old and lives with his life partner and their four dependent children who help him with his business. They live in the medium-sized hamlet of Yerma in the Cañarís district, Ferreñafe province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. In Yerma most people are farmers, raise livstock or engage in commerce, and they aspire to improve their situation.

Cristian's job is to provide transportation and he has a mototaxi which  he uses to provide this service. He has been doing this for more than five years and he works in his and neighboring communities. Thanks to the good service her provides he has many customers. In addition, he raises animals such as cattle and goats. He has very good personal references.

He will use the loan to invest in his business so he can perform maintenance on his mototaxi. This will ensure that his working tool operates properly so Cristian can continue to generate his own income.

loans.use: to invest in his business so he can perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Liezel is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested an amount of  PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like dresses and shirts to sell.

Liezel has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like dresses and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nimfa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Nimfa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Fedelina has been in this business for 18 years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 63 years old and married with ten children, one of whom is in school.  Marcela works very hard to provide for them.

Marcela runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Marcela has been in this business for 20 years. In the future Marcela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Mary Ann aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. Mercedita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mercedita has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Dieu Merci De Nossin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ANDREA représente le groupe  DIEU MERCI DE NOSSIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme vend divers marchandises (l’eau, savon, parfum local, balai etc.) depuis plus de 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur.
Mme veut s’acheter 80 boules de savon et 20 cartons d'OMO.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir une grande boutique et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Andrea represents the Dieu Merci De Nossin group. She is married mother to four children. The eldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 8. Three of her children go to school. She has six people living under her care. She has been selling different products (water, soap, local perfume, brooms, etc.) for over 20 years. She gets her supplies from the local market. She would like to purchase 80 bars of soap and 20 boxes of detergent. She wants to use her profits to strengthen her business. She aims to open a shop and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 80 bars of soap and 20 boxes of detergent

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en: Mrs. Chimgee, 44 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband are both tailors and work at a cashmere factory. Their children go to high school. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, so she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as shingles, bricks, planks and fiberglass. After renovation, her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate her house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. Marion hopes to live comfortably, in a house with a  good roof supported by her loan of Php 50,000. 

She hopes to maintain good standing in her membership through a good repayment record. Marion has been given priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. She is thankful that all her financing needs of her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for housing renovations.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 42 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. In the future, Jena wishes to become the supplier of gardening crops and vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer

location.town: Calamba - La Libertad, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippiness, happily married with five adult-age children. She ventured in the snack vending business to generate income for the family. Because she wants to add her inventory, Rosalinda requests money amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase oil, flour, and sugar. With her profit, she can repay the debt she owes from PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase oil, flour, sugar, etc for snack vending business to support her family

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. Wilma is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce to sell for her everyday income. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel works hard to support her family. Ritchel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, bamboo, and other items.

Ritchel has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, bamboo, and other items.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 54-years-old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Estrella has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Estrella has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Estrella would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 49 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items.

Rosario has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Rosario would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 35 years old and married with three children, whom are in school. Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs an ambulant vending household product business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 13 years.  In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Angelica is 31 years old and all of her children are in school.

Angelica has a jewelry business in the Philippines. Angelica requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of jewelry to sell.

Angelica has been in this business for two years. In the future, Angelica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is 46 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Bernadith works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Bernadith has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.  In the future, Bernadith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mansir

texts.en: Mansir is a maize farmer from Tsaunin Maiki village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mansir would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mansir can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Mansir said: “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Sabiu

texts.en: Sabiu is a maize farmer from Tsaunin Maiki village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sabiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sabiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sabiu said: “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 43 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains. Rosemarie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Bujar

texts.en:
