Bujar wants to repair the little room of his mother. “It is in such bad condition and my elderly mother lives there and it is not good for her at all. I can’t have her live like that, it breaks my heart,” said Bujar who is 47 and a father of two school aged children, aged 16 and 13. 
Bujar makes aluminum doors and windows and he is shown in the shop that he has been running. His wife works for pay at a nearby hotel. 
Bujar’s village is known for the large quantities of fresh leeks they produce but not so much for the livestock activity.

loans.use: to repair the little room of his elderly mother

loans.name: Tuweni Group

texts.en:
Esnat belongs to the Tuweni credit group which is comprised of 22 members. She is 34 years old and is married to Robert. She has four children who go to school and she supports her family by selling fritters such as doughnuts from her home. Esnat wants this loan to buy 1 bag of flour and cooking oil to produce more doughnuts and attract more customers.

She plans to use her profits to start building a house for her family and diversify her business by selling beans to maximize her profits. She believes that the business management training she received from the Microloan Foundation will help her to achieve what she wants. As a woman she is able to feed her family three meals a day and she has even managed to buy a radio cassette player.

loans.use: To buy flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Flor De Ilución Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ILUCIÓN” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cerveza, repuestos de autos, venta de joyas, venta de herramientas de automóviles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cerveza; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus amigas quienes realiza el mismo negocio, es por ello que como ya conoce la dinámica decide implementar su negocio independientemente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es divorciada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE ILUCIÓN” communal bank is starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Andes regional branch. It is made up of 10 members lead by a board of directors with Olga as President. The businesses of the members are varied amongst them are: selling beer, car parts, selling jewellery and selling automobile tools.

The loan that they will receive will help all these micro-entrepreneurs with Olga being one of them. She says that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer and she joined on the invitation of a representative of the institution who came to visit her in her home. Currently she has a business selling beer. She says that she learned this business from her friends who are involved in the same business. Once she understood the dynamics of the business she decided to start her won independent business.

The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital (buying beer wholesale) that she will acquire at the wholesale distributors in the city of La Paz. Later she will sell them in her sales space. Working in this way allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is divorced and has five children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy beer wholesale.

loans.name: Arrienne Jed

texts.en:
Arrienne Jed is studying Computer Programming at St. Paul Colleges Foundation. She chose this course because she wants to learn a lot about computers and because computer courses are in demand here and abroad. 

She wants to avail a P10,000 loan from Kiva lenders through ASKI to lessen her and her parents’ problem in paying her monthly tuition fees. 

She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan, for this will help her in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married with five children. She is 55 years old and lives in Lumipac, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. 

Rosalina is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and chemicals. 

Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Rosalina hopes to harvest more corn and engage in other business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for corn production.

loans.name: Metchilyn

texts.en:
Metchilyn, 45-years-old, is a widow with three children, all of whom are in school. Metchilyn is a resident of Mangidkid, Plaridel, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than 15 years. Fruit vending is her primary source of livelihood. She became a member of Paglaum MPC last May 2013. 

Recently, Metchilyn decided to apply for a loan to buy additional fruit for her fruit vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her children, and supply buco juice and durian candy.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal tiene 24 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyugue y sus hijos, en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Anibal es la cria y venta de ganado caprino, la compra lo raliza en su caserio, y la venta lo raliza en el pueblo de Chiple. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de mayor cantidad ganado caprino, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Anibal, 24, lives in his own house, which is made of rudimentary materials. He lives with his wife and their children, in the rural part of the Pucará district, province of Jaén, region de Cajamarca, Northern Andes of  Peru. They have water and electricity services. His community works mainly in agriculture, animal husbandry and commerce. Anibal works raising and selling goats. He buys them in his rural settlement, and sells his livestock in the town of Chiple. He will use the loan to buy more goats. This way he will generate more income and be able to improve his quality of life. In his region there is not much competition for his way of work, so he is able to get better prices. Therefore, in short term, it will allow him to improve his income, increase his earnings and as a result, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more goats.

loans.name: Maiden Joe

texts.en:
Maiden Joe is 32 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependent. 

Maiden Joe has been engaged in an e-loading and barbecue vending business for 10 years already. Their family is also earning support from his brother and sister. He earns approximately PHP10,000 each month from doing this type of work; this amount is so helpful to meet their family needs.

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional construction materials for the finishing of their ongoing house construction. 

Maiden Joe has been a member of PMPC just this year.  In the future, Maiden Joe hopes to expand his e-loading and barbecue vending business and to have his own family.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials

loans.name: Brigilda

texts.en:
This borrower's name is Brigilda, 41, a widow, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She has four children one of  whom is one is in college; one is already working and the other two are not in school. She manages a buy-and-sell business of ready-to-wear products and works doubly hard to provide for the family's daily needs and for the schooling of her child.

Brigilda buys general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells it piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from footwear to  ready-to-wear clothing and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every day.

Brigilda is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more merchandise such as footwear and ready-to-wear clothes to sell in preparation for the Christmas season. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

She hopes to have her own stall for her business. She also desires for her children to be able to complete their studies as well as to improve the general living conditions of her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional footwear  and add some ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
This is Judith. She is a 40-year-old resident of Tanza Cavite, Philippines. She has a child and she is married to Reynerio, a factory worker. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her child's education. She and her partner had to work hard for they are determined to have a better income.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Judith would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Judith hopes to progress in her business. She wants to give her family a better future through all her hard work in business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, conocido en el medio por su labor de crianza y venta de animales menores(pollos, cuyes, entre otros). Vive en casa familiar, hermano y cuñada. Oswaldo es una persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada a la ganaderia y agricultura, habitada por gente sencilla y amable; dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Oswaldo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, cuyes, patos ,pavos,etc, desde hace más de 03 años. Adicionalmente trabaja en peón agrícola en el Huerto Genesis. Necesita del préstamo para invertir en compra de cerdos y alimentos de engorde balanceados para estos, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 31 years old, single, and is known for raising and selling small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, etc.) He lives with his brother and sister in law and is from a solid family. He has good personal and work references. The people in his community are simple and kind and generally work in livestock and farming. It is located in the Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Oswaldo has been raising and selling small animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, turkeys, etc. for more than three years. He also works as a farmhand at the Genesis Orchard.  He needs the loan to invest in buying pigs and animal feed to fatten them up. This will allow him to increase his income and his profits in a short time, thereby improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Ma. Analou

texts.en:
Ma. Analou is 32 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Analou has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending. Ma. Analou aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en: Rechel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fish net, gasoline, wood, etc. Rechel has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Rechel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fish net, gasoline, wood, etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Elsie is borrowing 19,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fishing cage and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing cage and other fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Miguela is 51-years-old and has three children who are in school.

Miguela has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials for her business.

Miguela has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Miguela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials for her business

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is 57 years old and a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Perpetua has a business selling firewood in the Philippines. Perpetua requested a 6,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more firewood to sell.

Perpetua has been in this business for five years. In the future, Perpetua would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Marites has been in this business for five years. Marites earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 47 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Lolita has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Lolita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40-years-old and married with five children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Marites has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Marites aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Sale

texts.en: Sale is a maize farmer from Tsaunin Maiki village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sale would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sale can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sale said: “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a maize farmer from Kuruntumawa village. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Naomi would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Naomi can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Naomi said: “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en: Kabiru is a maize farmer from Kuruntumawa village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Kabiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Kabiru said: “I will now be able to use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including sugar, soaps, water, noodles, milks, eggs, cooking oils, candles, cigarettes, biscuits and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

She is taking this loan because she wants to add more goods in her kiosk according to what people like. She has been doing business since 2011 with her own working capital of $350. 

She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to have good management to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soaps, water, noodles, milks, eggs, cooking oils, candles, cigarettes, biscuits and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Niceta

texts.en:
Niceta works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Niceta has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Niceta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilou is 25 years old, and has one child in school.

Marilou has a furniture business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her furniture business.

She has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her furniture business

loans.name: Jenila

texts.en:
Jenila is 34 years old, and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenila has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of firewood to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jenila would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Elizabeth joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Philibus,Yakubu and Adamu. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Elizabeth would have to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Elizabeth can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Elizabeth said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Ishaya`

texts.en: Ishaya is a maize farmer from Toka village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaya had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ishaya said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
Santa Catalina se llama este grupo, está en su 3° ciclo, ellas son madres de familia que quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Lucila es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora, que se ha unido al grupo por su familia, para darles todo lo que ella no pudo. Ella se dedica a la venta de chipas, de manera ambulante, la chipa es un alimento típico paraguayo que se come en todo momento.
La Sra. Lucila pide este préstamo, para que por medio de el pueda comprar chipas,y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo, luchando por crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
Santa Catalina is the name of this communal banking group that is in its third loan cycle.  All of the women are mothers who want to help their loved ones through their work.  They are part of the program for the elimination of poverty.

Lucila is one of the group members and she is a very self-sacrificing and gritty woman.  She has joined the communal banking group for her family, in order to help them in every way she can.  She works selling "chipas" or Paraguayan cheese buns.  She sells them via a mobile cart and they are a very typical food in paraguay that is eaten all day long. 

Lucila is asking for a loan in order to purchase chipas and in that way continue with her work.  She is struggling to grow and improve.

loans.use: To purchase "chipas" - a type of Paraguayan cheese bun -- to resell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 59, is a resident from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has nine children. Victoria is engaged in a hog raising business and has raised pigs for more than three years now. This is her source of her income. Her husband is a farmer.

Victoria would like to avail a loan to buy additional piglets and animal feed. A loan will enable her to improve her hog raising business, thus augmenting her income and profit.

In the future, Victoria hopes to expand her hog raising business so that it will become more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Ildefonzo

texts.es:
ILDEFONZO TIENE 64 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CON SU CONYUGE, SU CASA ES DE MATERIAL RUSTICO CARACTERISCO DE LA ZONA, DEDICADO AL CULTIVO DE CAFÉ EN EL CASERIO DE BRASIL, EN EL DISTRITO DE COLASAY, EN LA PROVINCIA DE JAÉN, REGIÓN DE CAJAMARCA, SIERRA NORTE DE PERÚ. SU COMUNIDAD SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO, GANADERÍA, PERO PRINCIPALMENTE A LA AGRICULTURA.

ILDEFONZO SE DEDICA AL CULTIVO DE CAFÉ, DESDE HACE 20 AÑOS. SU TERRENO AGRÍCOLA ESTÁ UBICADO EN EL CASERIO DE BRASIL EN EL DISTRITO DE COLASAY. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA INVERTIR EN LABORES DE BUENAS PRACTICAS AGRÍCOLAS EN SU CULTIVO TALES COMO: PODAS, DESHIERBOS, ABONAMIENTOS. ILDEFONZO POSEE CONOCIMIENTOS EN EL NEGOCIO POR LO QUE SE ESPERA UNA GRAN COSECHA.
texts.en:
Ildefonzo is 64 and lives with his wife. Their house is made from rustic material characteristic of the area. 

He works in coffee cultivation in the small village of Brasil, in Colasay district, which is in Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region of Sierra Norte, Peru. People in his community work in the retail trade or stockbreeding, but mostly in agriculture.

Ildefonzo has been working in coffee cultivation for 20 years. His agricultural land is located in the small village of Brasil, in Colasay district.

The loan will be invested in agricultural activities which are good for his crops such as pruning, weeding and composting.

Ildefonzo has a lot of knowledge of this business and so he hopes for a great harvest.

loans.use: invest in agricultural activities which are good for his crops, such as pruning, weeding and composting.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 56 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el caserío Laynas, la vida en dicho caserío se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrolla sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales y siendo el anexo más grande del distrito de la Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Juan es la crianza y comercio de animales menores y también se dedica a la agricultura, la actividad la realiza desde hace más de 15 años, en el caserío Laynas. El destino del crédito será para realizar mejoras en su vivienda dado que se vienen las lluvias y Juan desea asegurar el techo de su casa para darle mayor comodidad y seguridad a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 56 years old and has a common law wife and four grown children.  He lives in his own  house with his wife in the hamlet of Laynas where life is very peaceful since most of the people work at farming or raising animals. Laynas is the largest section of Matanza in the province of Morropon which is in the Piura region on Peru's northern coast.

Juan raises and sells small animals and is also a farmer, which he has been doing for more than 15 years in Laynas. The loan will be used to make improvements to his house because the rainy season is coming and Juan wants to fix the roof so it will be more comfortable and safe for his family.

loans.use: l destino del crédito será para realizar mejoras en su vivienda.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal-retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Vilma is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to offer for sale.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Irene is 30 years old and has one child in school.

Irene has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish nets and materials for fishing.

Irene has been in this business for two years. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to puchase fish nets and materials for fishing

loans.name: Johnamay

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Johnamay works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Johnamay is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Johnamay has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Nelia has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 49 years old and married with four children and three of her children are in school.  Virgenia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like, beverages, canned goods, etc.

Virgenia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like, beverages, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Emily is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Edna

texts.en:
Ma. Eda is 48 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Eda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Eda has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma. Eda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ermina

texts.en:
Ermina works hard to support her family. Ermina is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc.

Ermina has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Ermina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 57 years old and married. She has four children.  

Edna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Edna has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Edna would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna works hard to support her family. Digna is married and has a selling vinegar business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of vinegar to sell.

Digna has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Digna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina is 42 years old and married with one child in school.  She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Lorina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en: Matthew is a maize farmer from Lumu village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Matthew had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matthew can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Matthew said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Muhammadu

texts.en: Muhammadu is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Muhammadu had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Muhammadu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Muhammadu said: “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Iliyasu

texts.en: Iliyasu is a maize farmer from Ali village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliyasu had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliyasu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Iliyasu said: “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment thus eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигине 29 лет. Она трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Нигина воспитывает одного ребенка. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Нигина является основной кормилицей семьи. Она занимается уже более 5 лет предоставлением услуги швеи. Нигина шьет как национальные, так и европейские стили одежды. Она имеет свой швейный цех. Ее цех находится в центре района, где много народа. Таким образом, она привлекает много клиентов. Нигина обучает несколько учениц своим ремеслом. Она должна оплатить за аренду помещения своего цеха и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nigina is 29 years old. She is a hardworking and cheerful woman and has one child. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Nigina earns the main income for her family and has been a seamstress for over five years. She sews traditional and European-style clothing. She has a sewing shop near the city center, where there are many people, and she attracts a lot of customers. Nigina also teaches a few students how to sew. She needs to pay the rent for her shop and is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: To pay the rent for her sewing shop

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Fatima está conformado por mujeres muy trabajadoras y con entusiasmo para poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian ,que se encuentra muy contenta por formar parte del comité, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, comenta que su trabajo es muy humilde, pero que por medio de el ayuda a sus familias y seres queridos.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados, para que de esa forma siga con su trabajo, esforzándose día a día.
texts.en:
The committee "Virgen de Fátima" is made up of very hard-working and enthusiastic women who want to be able to grow and help their families.  One of the group members is Lilian.  She is very glad to be part of the committee.  She is a very hard-working person who dedicates herself to the raising and selling of animals.  She comments that her work is very humble, but that through this work she helps her family and her loved ones.  

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase feed, which will allow her to continue her work, as she struggles day by day.

loans.use: To purchase feed for animals.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 17 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida para ellas y para su familia. Tienen como objetivo poner mucho empeño en sus actividades laborales para ir creciendo y ayudarse las unas a las otras, están luchando por sus familias y sus seres queridos.
Mary, una de las integrantes se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité así ella y sus compañeras cuentan con una oportunidad de poder trabajar. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, que ella misma prepara y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy trabajadora que está saliendo adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
 Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, hortalizas, y demás insumos, de manera a poder continuar con su lucha y trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of 17 women who are inspired to provide a good and better quality of life for themselves and their families.  Their goal is to put great effort into their work activities in order to grow and help themselves as a team.  They are struggling for their families and their loved ones.  Mary is one of the group members and she is glad to be part of the committee because she and her partners thus can count on opportunities for work . She works selling food which she herself prepares and then goes out to sell via a mobile cart.  She is a very hard-working woman who is getting ahead due to great effort and dedication. 

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase food items for her meals such as meat, condiments, vegetables, and other items.  This will allow her to continue struggling and working as she is doing now.

loans.use: to purchase food items for making meals to sell such as meat, condiments, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine, 41, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Dionisio and they have children. She manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Geraldine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Geraldine wants her variety store to become a department store someday. She also dreams that they will soon have their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 36 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge; tiene un hijo de 8 meses de edad; convive con su esposa hace tres años, vive en casa propia de material noble de dos plantas, mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros del distrito, es natural en distrito Santo Tomás de Cutervo. Vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Jaime es la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, posee 6 reses de su propiedad, tiene una has. de inverna donde cría su ganado vacuno, se dedica a la actividad pecuaria hace 4 años, ganado vende de manera trimestral en plaza de ganado del distrito, donde se reúnen moradores para ofertar el buen ganado que posee a compradores de la zona. También cultiva café Variedad catimor 0,5 has. plantación tiene 3 años de edad. El destino del crédito será para compra de ganado y sanidad del mismo, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 36 years old and has a stable home alongside his spouse. He has an 8 month old child. He has lives with his wife for 3 years. He lives in his own two story house made of rustic materials. His house has water and electricity. He maintains good relationships with his neighbors. He is a native of the Santo Tomás district of Cutervo. His community works mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. This district is located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru.

The work that Jaime does is raising and selling cattle. He has 6 cows on his property. He has one hectare of pasture where he raises the cattle and he has been doing this for 4 year. He sells the cattle 4 times a year in the district's livestock plaza where people offer their fine cattle to buyers of the area. He also grows Catimor varietal coffee planted on one half hectare three years ago. The loan will be used to buy cattle and medicine for them. With this he will get higher income to be able to improve the quality of living for his family.



.

loans.use: to buy cattle and medicine for them.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Her name is Josephine, 50, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Macario, a porter, and has five children. One is in college, one is in high school, two are in elementary level and the other one is already working. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her four children to school. 

Josephine has operated a variety store for twenty-seven years already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 3,000 a day. 

To help her continue operating her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Josephine hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life. She strives to hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more grocery items such as cookies, chips, eggs, oil, beverages and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
This is Bienvenida, 55, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Celso, her business partner, and she is mother to her children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support all her children’s educational needs.

Bienvenida operates an appliance-repair shop. Her husband is the main technician while she handles finances, accounts, inventory and promotion. They offer repair and check-up for all types of appliances like electric fans, washing machines, air-conditioners and others. Her shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts for appliances. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Bienvenida hopes to open branches of her business and she wants to give her children good and quality education through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for appliances and other materials needed in her appliance-repair business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Loreta has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Morata

texts.en:
Morata is 34 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like candies, bread, soft drinks, etc.

Morata has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Morata aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like candies, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 60 years old and married with two children.  She works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like, canned goods, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

She has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Consuelo would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like, canned goods, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Morata

texts.en:
Morata is 57 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Morata has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Morata has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Morata would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is 54 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Charlita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Charlita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Soké

texts.fr: Soké est née à Vogan, elle vit dans le quartier d’AHADJI-KPOTA,  à Lomé. Elle est   âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait le commerce bois de chauffe  à domicile. Elle va au marché 4 fois par mois et avec ce crédit elle veut acheter 8 sacs de charbons de 15 000 cfa le sac. Avec les revenus sur les ventes Soké arrive à contribuer aux charges de la faille.
texts.en: 26-year-old Soké was born in Vogan. She lives in Ahadji-Kpota district in Lomé. She is a married mother to one child. She sells wood charcoal out of her home. She goes to the market four times per month. With this loan, she wants to purchase eight sacks of charcoal, at 15,000 FCFA per sack. With the profits from selling this charcoal, Soké will be able to contribute towards paying for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of wood charcoal

loans.name: Shamsulo

texts.ru: Шамсуло умный, честный, перспективный  человек. Он родился в 1955 году. Шамсуло женат. Его жена работает уборщицей. Они имеют 2 детей. Шамсуло очень заботится о своих детях и всегда старается, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование. Его сын учится в университете, и он должен оплатить за его учебный договор.  Шамсуло хотел бы получить займ, чтобы оплатить за сумму годового договора обучения сына в Университете. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие и благодарит вас заранее за вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Shamsulo is a smart, honest, forward-looking person. He was born in 1955 and is married. His wife is a cleaning woman and they have two children. Shamsulo worries about his children and always tries to make sure that they will be able to get a higher education. His son is in university and needs to pay for his tuition. Shamsulo would like to take out a loan to pay for his son's annual tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your compassion. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 52 years old and lives in Coron Palawan, Philippines. Her husband is Jose and they have children. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more almost seven years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Belen would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 50,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Belen desires to become a successful businesswoman through all her hard work. She dreams for her family to be always happy and healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Khosiyatkhon

texts.ru: Хосиятхон 20 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Хосиятхон является студенткой 2 курса Медицинского Колледжа. Она учится в очное отделение. Хосиятхон является одной из успешных студентов, и она прошла практику за первый курс успешно. Она хочет работать в городской больнице после окончания колледжа.  Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Ее однокурсники и преподаватели знают ее как добросовестную и трудолюбивую. Ее родители очень гордятся ею. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в колледже. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khosiyatkhon is 20, unmarried, and lives with her parents. She is a full-time, second-year student at the Medical College. She is a successful student and passed her first year of training. She wants to work at the city hospital when she graduates. She is a very smart and hardworking woman. Her classmates and teachers know her to be diligent and hardworking, and her parents are very proud of her. She is requesting a loan to pay for her college tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 44 years old and married with six children.  With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing boat and fish net.

Lorna has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and fish net

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been pig fattening for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
Ma. Teresita is 49 years old and married with four children who are all attending school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Teresita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from E-Loading (mobile prepaid load). Ma. Teresita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Bernardita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Bernardita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell for her rice-retailing business.

Bernardita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Alma

texts.en:
Ma. Alma is 45 years old and married.  She has four children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, chips, etc.

Ma. Alma has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7seven years and also earns an income from a manicure service.  Ma. Alma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, chips, etc

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.  Monica has been in this business for one year. Monica earns additonal income from selling root crops.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.  Monica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is married and she works hard to support her family.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Madres emprendedoras, es un grupo muy luchador y que quiere salir adelante, ellas son unidas y solidarias las unas con las otras, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres.
María es una de las integrantes, es una mujer muy sacrificada, se dedica al humilde trabajo de lavandera, tiene siempre muchos clientes que le traen prendas para que lave. Gracias a que siempre da un buen servicio ya se hizo conocida y esta ganándose la vida de esta manera.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de jabones, suavizantes para prendas, lavandina y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
"Madres emprendedoras" is a group of fighters who want to get ahead. They are united and supportive of each other and work together in their businesses. They state that they are content and feel the support of the Woman's Committee program.

María is one of the members. She is s self sacrificing woman and she works as a humble laundry worker. She has many clients who bring her clothing to wash. Thanks to the fact that she always provides good service she has become known and she can earn her living in this way. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of detergent, softener, bleach, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy detergent, softener, bleach, etc.

loans.name: 15 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 15 de noviembre está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona muy alejada de la capital del país, que aun se encuentra en crecimiento, es eminentemente rural.
La Sra. Patricia es  la tesorera  del comité, ella se dedica a la ventas de empanadas, milanesas y crías de animales, desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de su trabajo vaya ayudando de una mejor manera a su familia.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como carne, harina, aceite, etc. y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo  y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The 15 De Noviembre group is in its first cycle with the women’s committee program.  They are from the city of Curuguaty, an area that is very far from the capital of the country.  It is an eminently rural area that is still growing.

Patricia is the treasurer of the communal bank.  She sells empanadas and ‘milanesas’ [breaded meat fillets], and she raises animals.  As time passes she wishes, through her work, to be helping her family in a better way.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make her food.  She will buy things like meat, flour, and cooking oil, etc.  This way she will be able to continue growing and giving her family what they need in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, and cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Nanci Judith

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Nanci, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad e independientes y los dos menores de edad aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio. Su marido es chofer. 
Doña Nanci trabaja de maestra en una escuela de la localidad y también se dedica al comercio, vende semijoyas de Romanel y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella también vende helados de una marca muy reconocida en el país, hace poco adecuo un local en su casa en la cual vende sus helados,  trabaja todos los días en todas sus actividades, cuando está trabajando en la escuela uno de sus hijos le ayuda con la heladería,  lleva más de 15 años dedicada al comercio pero uno con la heladería, la cual le está dando buenos resultados.
Este crédito es para comprar semijoyas, productos Yanbal y helados. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 15 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus metas son seguir trabajando y ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Monserrate gets together every 15 days in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts, which are recognized at the national and international level.  It is the place of the famous toquilla straw hats.

This is where Nanci lives.  She is 59 years old, married, and from this relationship has four children.  Two of her children are older and independent, and the two youngest still live with her and are in high school.  Her husband is a driver.

Doña Nanci works as a teacher in a school in town and also makes a living through sales.   She sells Romanel jewelry and Yanbal products (which include beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women). She also sells ice cream made by a very well-known brand in the country. She recently adapted a place in her house where she sells the ice cream.  She works every day with her many jobs.  When she is working at school, one of her children helps with the ice cream store.  She has spent more than 15 years making a living through sales, but only one with the ice cream store. 

This loan will be used to buy jewelry, Yanbal products, and ice cream.  She has been with the communal bank for 15 years and likes it for the help that the loans offer. Her goals are to continue working and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, Yanbal beauty products, and ice cream.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño Jesus es un grupo nuevo, formado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad muy alejada de la capital del país y que es eminentemente rural. Está en crecimiento, y gracias a las personas del grupo quieren ir mejorándolo.
La Sra. Lilian es  la tesorera  del comité, ella se dedica a la venta  de ropas que hace de manera ambulante, comenta que hoy día hay mucha competencia, pero que de igual manera se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de ropas para vender y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo  y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Divino Niño Jesús is a new group from the city of Curuguaty.  It is a city that is very far from the capital of the country.  It is eminently rural, and it is growing thanks to the people in the group who want to be improving it.

Lilian is the treasurer of the group.  She sells clothes in an itinerant manner.  She says that she now has a lot of competition.  However, she puts forth great effort in order to be able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy clothes to sell.  This way she will be able to continue growing and give her family what it needs in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Her name is Marilyn, 40, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. Married to Carlito, she has five children. One is in high school, two in elementary level and the other two are not of school age yet.  She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her four children to school. 

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells school supplies. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1500 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 42,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Marilyn hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they can have a better life. She strives to hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en: Bendita is married and she has one child. There are three members in the family including her husband. She is requesting a loan of USD 1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including noodles, detergent, cigarettes, and soft drinks.  She has been doing this business since 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she needs to take this loan, because she wants to know how to improve the management for a business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, detergent, cigarettes, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Caaguazú se llama 3 de Mayo, está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una puede conocer su situación de vida y conforme a ello poder mejorar.
Una mujer que se destaca es Bernardina, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas y de estación, con esta actividad le da a su familia lo que necesita para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Su sueño es poder tener un local grande de venta de frutas, de manera a poder seguir con su lucha de mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas de estación para la venta, como ser manzana, piñas, sandias, peras, y demás, de manera a continuar con su venta.
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Caaguazú, is called 3rd of May. They are part of the poverty elimination program, where each person can analyze their life situation and improve upon it accordingly. 
A woman who stands out is Bernardina, who makes a living selling fresh, in-season fruit. Through this activity she provides for her family the requirements for a dignified life with no deprivations. Her dream is to have a large locale to sell her fruit out of in order to continue her struggle for improvement. 
She is requesting this loan to purchase in-season fruits for sale, such as apples, pineapples, watermelons, pears and more in order to continue her business.

loans.use: purchase in season fruits such as apples, pineapples, watermelons, pears and more.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo de Mujeres Kuña Guapa, es  de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, y se ayudan conjuntamente.
La Sra. Nilsa la presidenta del grupo, ella vive con su hijo y su marido, son una pareja muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante. Ella es vendedora de prendas varias, una vendedora muy buena, y que gracias a su esfuerzo ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Nilsa pide este préstamo para invertirlo en su actividad ya que quiere comprar una buena variedad de ropas para grandes y chicos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group of woman called "Kuña Guapa" is from the city of San Lorenzo. They are united and supportive of each other and work together in their businesses and help each other as a group.

Nilsa is the president of the group. She lives with her son and her husband. They are a very hard-working couple who strive to get ahead. She is a seller of variety of clothing and is a very good seller. Thanks to her efforts she has a very good clientele. Nilsa is requesting a loan to invest in her business as she wants to buy a good variety of clothing for adults and children. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy clothing, adult and children, for resale.

loans.name: Sony Group

texts.en:
Semeni, 37 years old, is a single woman and a mother of four children attending school. She runs a mamalishe business serving breakfast, lunch and supper foods.  She has been doing this business since 2000.  Semeni works from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. per working day, and is able to realize a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her sixth credit request to be apportioned among SONY, a two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Semeni used the previous credits, since repaid, to improve her business with food cooking items. She managed to buy kilos of rice, a bucket of cooking oil, kilos of beans, maize and baking flour. She managed to receive some extra income, which she used to cover house rent, school fees, bought TV, sofa set and cupboard for utensils. She is so happy with Kiva's support. 

Semeni will use her part of the credit to buy cooking ingredients like rice, cooking oil, maize and baking flour, sugar etc. In the coming years, Semeni would like to improve her business more.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, cooking oil, maize and baking flour, sugar etc.

loans.name: Anamer

texts.en:
Anamer lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with 5 school-age children. Anamer supports her family. She ventures in a sari-sari store business. PMPC stood by her to start the business in 2011, of which she became a member in good standing. 

With a desire to earn more, she requested a loan amounting to 14,900 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase inventories. Someday, Anamer wishes for her store to become a mini grocery to sufficiently provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase inventories

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is 63 years old, happily married with two adult children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She became a regular member of PMPC and has actively participated in the various programs and services offered by the Co-op. Her husband is a farmer who plants corn, vegetables and beans. Farming is their major source of income.  In order to generate income for their daily needs, she engaged in snack vending. Lucila borrows money from the Co-op to buy additional ingredients for her food snack to increase production. She dreams of nothing more than to live a comfortable life and have adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food snacks ohto increase production

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.
