Juralyn has been engaged in operating a fishing boat and fishing traps (locally known as “payao,” fish cages) business for 9 years already. She earns approximately PHP10,000 each month doing this type of activity and that amount is very helpful to support her child. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional fishing gadgets and accessories for her existing business. 

Juralyn has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Juralyn hopes to expand her fishing business by acquiring additional “payao”.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing accessories so she can expand her business

loans.name: Gueguense Group

texts.es: Grupo El gueguense está conformado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Maria del Socorro de 40 años de edad, soltera, y madre de dos hijos quienes son su espíritu de superación; su negocio es una pulpería y venta de bisuterías  en su domicilio, desde hace tres años. Este crédito lo solicita para la inversión de productos en la pulpería como papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, gaseosas, galletas, pan, etc y en bisuterías como pulseras, prensadores, colas, entre otras. La segunda socia es Auxiliadora de 45 años de edad y su negocio es venta de ropa usada y doña Modesta de 53 años de edad su negocio es la venta de  perfumes Avon y Zermat a domicilio.
texts.en:
The Gueguense group is made up of three successful small businesswomen.  One of these is Maria del Socorro, who is 40 years old, single, and the mother of two children who inspire her to succeed.  She has a convenience store and sells jewelry from her home.  She has done this work for three years.

She is requesting this loan to purchase products for her convenience store, including toilet paper, sanitary napkins, sodas, cookies, bread, and to purchase jewelry, including bracelets.  

The second group member is Auxiliadora, who is 45 years old and sells used clothing.  Modesta is 53 years old and works selling Avon and Zermat perfumes from her home.

loans.use: to purchase toilet paper, sanitary napkins, sodas, cookies, bread, and jewelry, such as bracelets.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably with a house with good roofing, supported by her loan of Php 50,000 to purchase construction materials to provide a large and safe living space for the family. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. 

Edlyn has been given priority as a regular member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs for her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to provide a large and safe living space for the family

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 56 years old, married, and  blessed with 7 children. She has sold cereal for 10 years. 

She will use this loan to buy dry maize to sell and will use the anticipated profits to educate her son.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be successful, improve her family's living standards, and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Shelalyn

texts.en:
Shelalyn is a 29-year-old single woman who works hard to support her parents.

She has a restaurant  and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Shelalyn requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables, eggs, meat, and fish for her restaurant.

Shelalyn has sustained her business through  1 previous loan from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, eggs, meat, and fish.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie works hard to support her family. She is 32 years old and has had a dried fish making business for 4 years.

She requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish.

In the future, Genie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sinamay weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

Analyn requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her weaving business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Analyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Leonita has been in this business for 11 years now.

Leonita requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Leonita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kauta

texts.en:
Kauta used the previous loan to buy phones to sell. He is still in the phone business, and he runs it 7 days a week.

He faces the challenges of limited capital and high rental fees.  Besides that, he hopes to construct rental units. Kauta needs a loan to buy phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a married farmer with 6 children who are 12, 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years old.  

He has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGZ to buy fertilizer and mulch for his farm. He also trades cattle to earn additional income and supplement  his monthly earnings. 

He is a hardworking man who works 8 hours a day, 6 days a week. He started farming in 2006 in a rural setting and has seen the business grow from one level to another through his hard work. He started this business to be able to have a source of income to cater for his family needs. 

 His major challenge in the business is competition from other farmers but is ready to overcome that through his hard work. He hopes to educate  his children in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and mulch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase an assortment of quilted products and clothes

loans.name: Manuel Andres

texts.es:
Manuel es un distribuidor de carne de cerdo, aseo, responsabilidad, amabilidad, honrado, y gran sentido de pertenencia hacia sus clientes son las características de este carismático padre de familia de 8 hijos, todos ellos a cargo de él y puede mantenerlos gracias al negocio de carne de cerdo. 
Manuel buscando mejores ingresos para su numerosa familia quiere solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de 7 cerdos para distribuir su carne pro el sector y mejorar su rentabilidad para darles a  los pequeños la oportunidad de ingresar a una escuela. 
Como todo padre responsable el sueño de Manuel es ver que sus hijos sean felices, que estudien, que puedan vivir mejor y nunca lleguen a pasar ninguna necesidad.
texts.en:
Manuel works as a pork distributor.  This charismatic father of eight is clean, responsible, kind, honest, and has a good sense of belonging toward his customers.  All of his children are in his care and he can support them thanks to his business.

Manuel wants to improve his income for his large family, so he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seven pigs to distribute their meat in his area.  This will improve his profitability, so he can give his children the opportunity to attend school.

As a responsible father, Manuel's dream is to see that his children are happy, educated, and that they can live a better life and never want for any necessities.

loans.use: to purchase seven pigs to distribute meat in his area.  He is the father of eight children and wants to improve their lives.

loans.name: Essohaname

texts.fr: Essohaname, âgée de 21 ans, vit à Lomé dans le quartier Baguida ; elle est mariée et a un enfant. Elle est commerçante de tissus et de pagnes Bazin depuis 2008 et vend de manière ambulante dans les environs.Essohaname vit dans une maison en location, se nourrit deux fois par jours et a un niveau d’étude secondaire ; elle s’approvisionne quatre(04) fois par mois pour l’unique activité exercée. Elle désire avoir un soutien financier pour accroitre son activité génératrice de revenu pour aider son foyer à mieux s’en sortir dans les dépenses quotidiennes et maximiser de profits.
texts.en:
Essohaname is 21 years old and lives in Lomé in the Baguida neighborhood. She is married and has one child. She lives in a rented house, eats twice a day, and has a high school education.

Essohaname has been selling fabric and Bazin pagnes by traveling around her area since 2008.

She procures her goods four times a month so that she can make her sales.

She wishes to have financial support so that she can expand her business, maximize her profits, and support her family.

loans.use: to buy six lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Jorge Orlando

texts.es: Jorge es un señor de buen carácter, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, y se encuentran asistiendo a l escuela, vive en una casas por la que paga arriendo y ahí tiene un espacio donde puede tener chanchos, Jorge juntamente con su esposa se dedican al jornal de trabajo del campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, lo que Jorge aspira es mejorar su negocio y tener una buena ganancia para de ahí ayudarse con los gastos de educación que tiene de sus hijos, para que ellos se formen como profesionales.
texts.en: Jorge is a man with a good character, he is married and has 2 children, one of 8 and one of 9 years old, who are both attending school. They live in houses where they pay rent and there they have a space where they can keep pigs.  Jorge, together with his wife, make a living working labor in the fields. The loan they will use to invest in pigs.  What Jorge aspires to is bettering his business and having good enough profits to then help with the costs of education for his children, so that they can study and become profesionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Nongkiasleuang Group

texts.en:
Thieo's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Thieo’s, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Thieo is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Thieo due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kachu Group

texts.en: Somchid is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Somchid's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  Even though some people in the village, including Somchid’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Somchid and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Somchid's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from three to five years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work as well as improving a family’s income and overall well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 51 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now adults. 

For her source of livelihood, Cherry has been engaged in managing her sari-sari store business for 24 years already. She is also engaged in a  coconut shell buying and selling business and earns approximately PHP20,000 each month doing this type of business activity to help her husband in providing their family's needs. She has requested a loan to be used in acquiring an additional parcel of cocoland pawned to her and aims to earn additional income for the family.
  
Cherry has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Cherry hopes to expand her sari-sari store and can acquire more cocoland to add to their family assets and income.

loans.use: to acquire an additional parcel of cocoland

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Grupo Jehova es mi fortaleza está conformado por tres socias laboriosas, micro empresarias; una de ellas es la señora Tamara de 33 años de edad, soltera, y su negocio es compra y venta de ropa y bisuterías. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de docenas de ropa para mujeres y hombres como camisetas, blusas, pantalones, etc y en bisuterías como pulseras, anillos, aretes, cadenas, etc. La segunda socia es Ericka de 36 años de edad, propietaria de una Pulpería y Rosibel de 36 años de edad ofrece cosméticos cerca de su domicilio.
texts.en:
The group Jehova Es Mi Fortaleza (Jehova is my Strength) is a group made up of 3 hardworking micro entrepreneurs, one of which is Tamara of 33 years old, who is single.  Her business is the buying and selling of clothes and jewelry.  She is requesting the loan to buy dozens of clothes for women and men like shirts, blouses, pants, etc. and in jewelry like bracelets, rings, earrings, chains, etc. 

The second business partner is Erika who is 36 years old, owner of a corner store and Rosibel is 36 years old and she offers cosmetics close to her home.

loans.use: to buy dozens of clothes for women and men like shirts, blouses, pants, etc. and in jewelry like bracelets, rings, earrings, chains, etc.

loans.name: Andrisa

texts.en:
Andrisa works hard to support her family. Andrisa is married and has had a nipa roofing business for 10 years.

Andrisa requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  nipa roofing to sell to her customers.

Andrisa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nipa roofing  to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is married with four children, three attend school.. She is a 31-year-old hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorena has has a dried fish making business for 10 years  and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to make dried fish.

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 55 years old and married with four children.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products and electronic mobile load (mobile phone credits) retailing.

Evangeline aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 46-year-old married woman living in Masindi-Uganda. She runs a restaurant and rental units to earn an income. She also owns a retail shop  to supplement her income. 

She used a previous loan to buy soap and sugar to sell and started the business to meet her family's needs.  She wishes to educate her children at the university. She has  inadequate capital and needs a loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es:
Javier un empresario de 41 años de edad, que se levanta a trabajar en el campo desde que sale el sol hasta que se oculta, diariamente. Es padre de 3 hijos varones de 15, 17, 19 años de edad, aspira que alguno de estos muchachos tome las riendas un día del negocio familiar para que el pueda disfrutar de una vejez tranquila pero mientras seguirá trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de semillas para cultivar fresa, abonos, riegos, fertilizantes.
Con la ayuda de este crédito tendrá un nuevo producto en sus terrenos, aspira a seguir por esa buena senda pero necesita la cooperación de los prestamistas de buen corazón que apoyen a una población tan descuidada pro el gobierno como lo son los agricultores.
texts.en:
Javier, 41, is an entrepreneur. He wakes up when the sun comes out and works until it goes down, every day. He is the father of three sons, aged 15, 17, and 19. He hopes that one of them takes over the family business so that he can rest when he gets old. For now, he will continue working in order to improve his living conditions.

He wants to request a loan to buy seeds to grow strawberry, fertilizers and tools for irrigation.

This loan will help him to grow a different type of crop. He hopes to continue in the right direction, but he needs the help of good-hearted lenders that support farmers, a vulnerable population neglected by the government.

loans.use: to buy strawberry seeds, fertilizers and irrigation tools.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 52-year-old  hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He grows pineapples as his main source of income. He started this business to improve his standard of living and educate his children. He faces challenges such as changing  seasons  and diseases that affect his produce.  He has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer.

He is requesting for a loan to buy manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: José German

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad, él no pudo asistir a la escuela debido a la situación económica en su familia, actualmente está soltero pero tienes tres hijos de 22, 19 y 16 años que aún viven con él; su madre los dejo desde muy pequeños y él los ha sacado adelante. 

José es agricultor desde muy pequeño aprendió la agricultura observando a su padre en su trabajo diario por la falta de estudios no pudo tener un trabajo formal y la agricultura fue una de las pocas opciones que tenía para generar ingresos al hogar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes y abono para su cultivo de maíz. Lo cual le ayudara a germinar mas tanto en calidad como en cantidad, también espera vender una parte de su cosecha para generar ingresos, a futuro piensa solicitar un crédito para comprar vacas ya que por ser agricultor le es viable la crianza de esta especie y con la leche poder iniciar la venta de lácteos.
texts.en:
José, 52, was unable to attend school due to the economic situation of his family. He is currently single but has three children aged 22, 19, and 16 who live with him still. Their mother left them when they were very young and he has raised them.

José is a farmer of a tiny farm. He learned from watching his father in his daily work. Because of his lack of schooling, he could not have a formal job. Agriculture was one of the few options for income generation for his home.

The loan he is requesting is for fertilizer and manure for his crop of maize. It will help germinate more quantity and quality of maize. He also hopes to sell some of the crop to generate income in the future. He intends to apply for a loan to buy cows because, as a farmer, he can breed them and start selling milk.

loans.use: to fertilize his maize crop.

loans.name: Cesar Darío

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven de 21 años muy creativo y capaz de ejecutar grandes proyectos, desde joven su padre le heredo unos bellos campos y Cesar no conforme quiere engrandecer la empresa que su padre le dejo y lo hará con la ayuda de un crédito que usara para la compra de 5 mil plantas de pimentón, abonos, riegos e insecticidas.
Con este joven trabajan otras dos personas y quieren seguir proyectándose y abastecer el mercado local con sus frescos productos.
Esta será la primera experiencia crediticia de Cesar y se compromete a pagarla cumplidamente ya que le están permitiendo expandirse y cultivar más productos que gozan miles de familia desde la comodidad de su casa.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young, 21-year-old man who is very creative and able to complete large projects. 

Since he was a child, his father left him beautiful fields and Cesar did not want to enlarge the business that his father left him. He will do it with a loan that he will use to buy five thousand pepper plants, fertilizers, irrigation, and insecticides. Two other people work with this young man and they want to keep coming to the local market and supplying it with their fresh products. 

This will be the first loan experience for Cesar, and he promises to pay it back in full since it is allowing him to expand and grow more products which thousands of families enjoy from the comfort of his home.

loans.use: to buy 5,000 pepper plants, fertilizers, irrigation, and insecticides.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Mama est âgée de 33 ans ; elle est  mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle vend de la farine  Manioc qu’elle achète  au marché de Gboto  et revend  au marché d’Adawlato. Elle a demandé ce crédit pour  acheter 230 bols de farine. Elle va au marché 3 fois par mois et avec les revenus de ses ventes elle arrive à participer aux charges familiales et à la scolarité de son enfant
texts.en:
Mama is 33 years old, married, and a mother of one child. She works buying cassava flour from a market in Gboto and reselling it in a market in Adawlato.

Mama is seeking a loan to buy 230 bowls of flour. 

She goes to the market three times a month, and with her earnings she is able to help with her family's expenses and her child's education.

loans.use: to buy 230 bowls of cassava flour

loans.name: Phonsaart Group

texts.en:
Kheuavan's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Kheuavan, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Kheuavan is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. 

The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Kheuavan due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works for three-five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 35-year-old mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Samina's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. Due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a position to purchase fruits for his business. Therefore Samina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband purchase the above items for business purposes. 

Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Phonngam Group

texts.en: Home's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking, without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Home is excited that she, like the other members of her group, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. This is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne causes of disease.  Some people in the villages, including Home’s, are able to buy bottled water. But the water filter increases the disposable incomes of users like Home, by decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The water filter also benefits its users by decreasing the amount spent purchasing charcoal, and by decreasing the time spent foraging for wood.  The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so the member's family can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonsawang Group

texts.en:
Khamluen's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. However, the water from natural sources in Khamluen's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Khamluen is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. This is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. 

Even though some people in the village, including Khamluen, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users since they spend less on bottled water. Khamluen and other filter users also buy less charcoal fuel used to boil water and spend less time foraging for firewood. Khamluen's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en:
Khouloud is a 30-year-old single lady who is the sole breadwinner for eight members of her family. She has worked as a secretary for two years and is working hard to support her family as much as she can.

Khouloud is a person with no official nationality, to be registered in Lebanon. This is very hard for her and her family members to benefit from any civil rights in Lebanon. That's why she has been working so hard since long ago to acquire the Lebanese nationality, which will change her family's living to a better one, hopefully. 
Her acquired loan will be invested in paying for the necessary official fees to finally have the Lebanese nationality.

It is hard for anyone to feel that she is deserted from her own civil rights everywhere. So hopefully, Khouloud will find peace in her new longing for the future.

loans.use: to pay for the necessary official fees to acquire the Lebanese nationality.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед молодой и умный человек. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Хуршед после окончания средней школы поступил в университет. Данное время он является студентом 3 курса Энергического Университета Таджикистана. Хуршед учится отлично и хорошо. Он любит читать книги и газеты. В свободное время он посещает интернет кафе. Он всегда старается расширить свой кругозор. Хуршед активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khurshed is a smart young man. He is not married and lives with his parents. He went to university after graduating from high school and is currently a third-year student at the Tajik Energy University. He is a very good student and loves to read books and newspapers. In his free time he goes to the internet cafe. He is always trying to expand his horizons and actively participates in university activities. He needs to pay for his tuition but does not have the money. He is requesting a loan of $500 USD and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Deditha

texts.en:
Deditha works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish. Deditha has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Deditha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old, widowed, and has six children, one of whom attends school. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells splash products in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from selling frozen products.

Delia requested another loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell
